attributes.name: Legend of the Four Starmetal Tyrants

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE2_description
attribs.current: Before attempting an attack roll, the mech can activate this ability to roll 1d4 and add the result as an insight bonus to the attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE3_description
attribs.current: The mech makes an attack against a single mech. If the attack’s damage causes system damage, the operator can choose which component takes system damage, excluding the power core or cockpit.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE4_description
attribs.current: The mech makes an attack against a single mech. If the attack’s damage causes system damage, the operator can choose which component takes system damage, excluding the power core or cockpit; if the mech expended 3 PP, the operator can select any component to take the system damage.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE5_description
attribs.current: After hitting a creature with an attack, but before dealing damage, the mech increases its weapon’s damage value by one step against that creature (e.g. medium damage instead deals high damage). A weapon that already deals extreme damage instead adds 1 additional damage for every damage die rolled for the attack. This ability can’t be used for weapons that attack an intersection rather than a creature, such as weapons with the explode weapon special property.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE6_description
attribs.current: Choose one skill. Until the beginning of the mech’s next turn, operators add any insight bonuses they have that apply to that skill to the mech’s checks with that skill.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE7_description
attribs.current: Activate this ability when regaining Shield Points. The number of SP the mech recovers increases by 1d8. This increases by an additional 1d8 at tier 5 and every 5 tiers thereafter.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NJS2OxmOSHa76hGaYE8_description
attribs.current: Before attempting a saving throw, the mech can activate this ability to roll 1d4 and add the result as a resistance bonus to the saving throw.

attribs.name: mech_content
attribs.current:
Cost 1 × tier
Effect Increase the mech frame’s base HP by 5, and increase its HP advancement by 1.

attribs.name: mech_lower_limbs_description
attribs.current: These legs provide basic mobility and little else.

attribs.name: mech_upper_limbs_description
attribs.current: These lightweight arms boast peerless stability and accuracy.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzV7OaXg6kxBSCmfwD_description
attribs.current: This simple system consists of a secure, reinforced, motion-activated door that’s programmed to open when one of a mech’s registered operators enter or exit. An entry hatch system allows a pilot to enter or exit the mech as a move action. A registered operator can instead spend 1 Resolve Point to enter or exit as a swift action.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-upgrades_-NKzVLKh-CljQrEuRovF_description
attribs.current: Increase the mech frame’s base HP by 5, and increase its HP advancement by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzVNh-MAfSIQcY9iD0_description
attribs.current: This system consists of energetic nodes that connect to the mech’s sundry weapon mounts. When purchasing this auxiliary system, choose two of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzVNh0ezdBKZiuColI_Description
attribs.current: Choose one of the weapon core’s two types of energy. As part of a standard action or full action used to make one or more attacks with one of the mech’s melee weapons, the mech charges the weapon with the chosen energy; the energy selected must be a type of energy damage the weapon doesn’t currently deal. Until the end of the mech’s turn, half of the damage dealt by this weapon is replaced with damage of the chosen type. If the weapon already deals two types of damage, replace one of them with the chosen energy damage. This effect never causes a weapon that normally targets KAC to target EAC.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzVNh0ezdBKZiuColJ_Description
attribs.current: As part of a standard action to make a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, the mech infuses the weapon with telekinetic magic, granting the weapon the effects of the returning weapon fusion for 1 minute. The mech can apply this effect only to mech weapons, not to improvised weapons like those thrown with the hurl special action

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzVkzO3E58Sb83Spho_Description
attribs.current: When making a full attack entirely with the missile battery, the mech can fire two, three, or four missiles. It takes a –3 penalty to the attacks if it fires two missiles, a –4 penalty if it fires three missiles, or a –5 penalty if it fires four missiles.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzVw9Pr9ww7meaImYq_description
attribs.current: A mech frame infused with siccatite shimmers faintly with threads of silver and radiates an aura of cold or heat, depending on the type of siccatite used. When selecting this upgrade, choose either cold or hot siccatite. The mech gains the following special abilities.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzaFZQpbJLLspFsN1t_description
attribs.current: As a reaction when it would take damage from a melee attack, the mech can summon a shield of hot or cold flame, depending on its type of siccatite. The mech gains a +2 bonus to its EAC and KAC, potentially turning the attack into a miss. If the attack still hits, the attacker takes damage equal to the mech’s tier (cold damage if cold siccatite, fire damage if hot siccatite).

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzaKeTs96xgAJiUGDP_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mech alters the temperature in an 80-foot radius around itself, dealing 6d8 cold (if cold siccatite) or fire (if hot siccatite) damage to all enemy creatures and mechs in the area (Reflex for half, DC = 15 + the mech’s tier).

attribs.name: mech_content
attribs.current:
Cost 2 × level
Type melee; Special analog, penetrating, reach, thrown (40 ft.)
Damage medium; Damage Type P or S; Critical —
Slots 2 (upper limb)
Skewer (1 PP) As a standard action, the mech makes an attack against multiple targets in an area as though the spear had the line weapon special property. The length of the line equals the mech’s reach with the spear.  This heavy projectile ends in a shining adamantine alloy tip and can be thrown or jabbed at enemies.  Special Property Descriptions  Analog This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to abilities that target technology. While this use of the word “analog” is not technically correct when referring to technology, use of the term in this way has become common.  Penetrating A penetrating weapon is designed to punch through large objects’ outer layers, making it easier to damage them. A penetrating weapon ignores an amount of hardness equal to the weapon’s level.  Reach Only melee weapons can have the reach special property. Wielding a weapon with reach gives you 10 feet of reach for attacks with that weapon. See Reach and Threatened Squares for more information.  Thrown Ranged weapons that must be thrown and melee weapons that can be thrown as a ranged attack have the thrown special property. You apply your Strength modifier to damage rolls for thrown attacks. After you throw a weapon, it lands near your target and you must recover it if you want to attack with it again.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzXTiqZRcEPgZbQl2u_Description
attribs.current: As a full action, the mech reconfigures its body and ordinance into a siege configuration, providing the stability and power necessary to bombard distant targets. While configured in this way, the mech can’t fly, and its other movement speeds are reduced to 10 feet. The rocket launcher’s range increases to 500 feet, its explode property’s radius increases to 20 feet, and it deals medium damage for a weapon of its level. The mech can end the siege configuration as a full action.

attribs.name: mech_lower_limbs_description
attribs.current: These lean and powerful legs enable sudden bursts of speed.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzXa3DFXaGlL1Bbfp8_Description
attribs.current: The mech gains a +10-foot enhancement bonus to its speed for 1 round.

attribs.name: mech_upper_limbs_special
attribs.current: Increase the mech's Strength modifier by 1.

attribs.name: mech_upper_limbs_description
attribs.current: These arms provide the mech with legendary strength.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzXfjbcHpCCTov9Z7y_description
attribs.current: This simple system consists of a secure, reinforced, motion-activated door that’s programmed to open when one of a mech’s registered operators enter or exit. An entry hatch system allows a pilot to enter or exit the mech as a move action. A registered operator can instead spend 1 Resolve Point to enter or exit as a swift action.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzXmtJEZdmkZyKEhZZ_description
attribs.current: When installed into a mech with thrusters, these winglike extensions to the mech’s frame allow it to fly for longer and higher when it activates its Power Jump ability.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzXuL0reZNXOBi3wpg_description
attribs.current: Noqual-infused mechs have green crystalline inlays worked into their frames, and magic used around them sometimes falters. Mechs with noqual frames gain the following special abilities.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzY8PZflbXUgKzUjnK_description
attribs.current: These circuits channel the dissipating force of a mech’s shields, transforming the energy into offensive power.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzY8PZflbXUgKzUjnL_Description
attribs.current: As a reaction when the mech takes damage that causes it to lose Shield Points, the mech channels the shields’ lost energy into one of its weapons that deals energy damage. The next time the weapon deals damage before the end of the mech’s next turn, the weapon deals additional damage equal to half the number of SP the mech lost from the triggering attack.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-auxiliary-systems_-NKzYD-Mhfvip-YlVAms_description
attribs.current: The mech’s array of powerful engines enable it to fly across short distances.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzYD-Mhfvip-YlVAmt_Description
attribs.current: The mech can activate the thrusters as part of a move action, granting it a fly speed of 60 feet (average maneuverability) with a maximum height of 30 feet. The mech must either land at the end of this movement, expend additional PP to perform additional power jumps before the end of its turn, or fall.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzZ6BZ3BhzPAjVWxfe_Description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mech makes an attack against multiple targets in an area as though the spear had the line weapon special property. The length of the line equals the mech’s reach with the spear.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzazjaxFV5xQCibNrk_description
attribs.current: The mech adds an additional 30 feet to the maximum height of its fly speed when using Power Jump. After jumping, the mech remains floating in the air in the same position until the beginning of the operator’s next turn. Remaining in the air for additional time requires additional uses of this ability; otherwise, the mech begins falling at a rate of 5 feet per round.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzb7Y18kpmBEI83Ffd_description
attribs.current: The mech can activate this ability when making a single attack against a magical construct or foe capable of spellcasting. If the attack hits the mech increases its damage dice by 2 × the PP expended.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzbl3lIKLJAJQqiHTA_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mech can create a magic-dampening aura around itself. The effect lasts for 1 round, though the mech can extend the duration each round by expending 1 PP as a free action. Spells or spell-like abilities cast within an 80-foot radius of the mech have a 25% chance of failure while this aura is active.

attribs.current: Consisting of light-warping and sound-dampening technomagical mechanisms installed just beneath the armor, a cloaker system enhances a mech’s ability to avoid notice. The mech gains the ability to attempt Stealth checks.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzYkswu65FbNbwrJ6c_Description
attribs.current: As a full action, the mech initiates active camouflage, granting it concealment until it makes an attack or performs other harmful actions, at which point the effect ends. If the mech begins combat while this ability is active, it begins the encounter with 1 less PP (minimum 1).

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzYkswu65FbNbwrJ6d_Description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mech fades from view as per invisibility. The effect lasts for 1 round, though the mech can extend the duration each round by expending 1 PP. The effect ends if the mech makes an attack or performs other harmful actions.

attribs.name: mech_content
attribs.current: Prerequisite: The mech must have a phase frame.  Technomagical conduits weave through every part of the mech, constantly analyzing the mech’s position and calculating dozens of other possible positions nearby. With a burst of energy, the mech can teleport to any of these destinations.  Phase (2+ PP) As a standard action, the mech instantly teleports itself and its operators to any point within 60 feet that it can see, as per dimension door. For each additional PP expended when activating this ability, the range increases by 60 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzZR5LocU0hACSAlZi_Description
attribs.current: As a move action, the mech reconfigures the swordwhip from a solid blade into a fiery, shearing lash for 1 round. In this form, the swordwhip gains the reach and trip special weapon properties; it gains the burn critical hit effect, and it deals a combination of fire and slashing damage.

attribs.name: mech_lower_limbs_special
attribs.current: The mech gains a +4 bonus to its KAC against bull rush and trip combat maneuvers.

attribs.name: mech_lower_limbs_description
attribs.current: The mech has four spider-like legs that provide exceptional stability.

attribs.current: A mech with a horacalcum frame has a dull coppery sheen, and time functions strangely around it, potentially creating permanent areas of altered time-flow if the mech stays in one location long enough. A horacalcum frame grants a mech the following special abilities.

attribs.current: As a reaction when it would take damage from a ranged attack, the mech can try to dodge the hit, attempting a Reflex saving throw with a DC equal to 15 + the enemy creature’s CR or mech tier. On a success, the attack misses.

attribs.name: repeating_mech-abilities_-NKzckS30trtwxLHHZpZ_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mech can emanate a burst of chronological energy in an 80-foot radius. Allied creatures and mechs within the area can take an extra move action on their turn, while enemy creatures and mechs within the area must succeed at a Will save with a DC equal to 12 + 1/2 your mech’s tier or lose their move action for the turn. This effect lasts for 1 round.

attribs.name: defensive_abilities
attribs.current: Fast Healing 5 (Within 60 feet of a Wellspring Fissure)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzdyUrXnMXCWbdIfq6_description
attribs.current: The eyes of an earthhallowed guardian emit a bright glow from the wellspring energy infused within. A creature who can see an earthhallowed guardian must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude saving throw against this ability, or it’s blinded until the beginning of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKze4caCtvgegQVJAg5_description
attribs.current: A creature who takes critical hit damage from an earthhallowed guardian must attempt a DC 17 Reflex save. On a failure, all charges are drained from the battery of a technological weapon the creature is wielding; if the creature is wielding more than one technological weapon, the weapon drained is determined randomly. If the earthhallowed guardian successfully siphons charges this way, it gains the benefits of haste until the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzeCdlsQ237LUQwpp5_description
attribs.current: As a swift action, an earthhallowed guardian can form nearby wellspring energy into a superheated lance that functions as a thrown weapon with a range of 40 feet. The earthhallowed guardian must be within 60 feet of a wellspring fissure to use this ability.

attribs.name: defensive_abilities

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfScJEHP4dHjm5ofk_description
attribs.current: Once per day as a standard action when within 60 feet of a wellspring fissure, a wellspring wisp can absorb a large amount of energy from the wellspring and exude it outward in a 30-foot burst. Non-wellspring wisps in the area take 6d6 force damage and are blinded for 1 round. A creature who succeeds at a DC 15 Fortitude save takes half this damage and is instead dazzled for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfScJEHP4dHjm5ofk_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Blinded for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfScJEHP4dHjm5ofk_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Dazzled for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfk9KP23MDzTCORce_description
attribs.current: Wellspring wisps feed on wellspring energy and need to remain near wellspring fissures for sustenance. A wellspring wisp that’s more than 1 mile away from a wellspring fissure is fatigued and begins to starve (Core Rulebook 404), treating each hour as one day for starvation, until it returns within range of a fissure.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfp2L257VeLUOlUS7_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a wellspring wisp can emit an eerie hum to enthrall other creatures. Non-wisps within 60 feet who can hear the peculiar humming must succeed at a DC 15 Will save or be fascinated for as long as they’re able to hear the sound. Each round, a fascinated creature moves toward the source of the noise but gets a new save against the effect at the end of its turn. If the creature takes damage, the effect ends immediately.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzez1vlTxE6tyXApNG_target
attribs.current: One Creature or Object No Morehtan 50 Bulks

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzez1vlTxE6tyXApNG_description
attribs.current:
The Creature or Object touched becomes Invisible. If the Target is a Creature, any gear it is carrying vanishes as well. If you cast the spell on someone else, neither you nor your allies can see the Target unless you can normally see Invisible things or you employ magic to do so.

The spell ends if the Target Attacks any Creature. For purposes of this spell, an Attack includes any spell or harmful Effect targeting a foe or whose area or Effect includes a foe. Actions directed at unattended objects don’t break the spell. Spells that specifically affect allies but not foes are not Attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area. Causing harm indirectly is not an Attack. Thus, an Invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon Security forces and have them Attack, start a trash compactor with foes inside, remotely trigger traps, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzf0m5XEMA4EEztnfO_description
attribs.current: A wellspring wisp restores up to 10 Charges to a Battery or 5 Charges to a Technological Item capable of being charged by a Battery. Since this spell takes the wellspring wisp's Personal energy, it must spend 1 Resolve Point to cast it. If the wellspring wisp recharges a Battery, there is a 20% chance the Battery is destroyed by the attempt. If the wellspring wisp restores more Charges than the item can hold, the item must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d6 electricity damage for each excess Charge. This spell provides no knowledge of how many Charges an item can safely hold, but the wellspring wisp can choose to bestow fewer Charges than the maximum allowed to reduce the risk; it must declare how many Charges it is restoring before casting this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzf3kDIZ6e8U6SpDdi_target
attribs.current: 50 ft.-Radius Cylindery, Equally High; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzf3kDIZ6e8U6SpDdi_description
attribs.current:
A wellspring wisp alters the movement of air in an area around it. Wind created by this spell imposes a penalty to Perception checks equal to the penalty the wind imposes on non-energy Ranged weapon Attacks (see Wind Effects table in the Core Rulebook). At the GM’s discretion, outdoor wind Conditions are generally Light Wind, while indoor wind Conditions are generally no wind; these Conditions can vary by Environment. This spell can’t create wind in an area that has No Atmosphere.

1st: When the wellspring wisp casts Control winds as a 1st-level spell, it can lower or raise the wind speed in the area by one level (for Example, from Strong Wind to either moderate or severe wind), to a minimum of no wind and a maximum of Severe Wind.

If the wellspring wisp creates a blast of wind when it dismisses the spell or it otherwise ends, the blast is Windstorm level. Creatures are treated as one size category smaller when determining the effects of the blast on them.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzf5ojcZNkC2zUnuZS_description
attribs.current:
A wellspring wisp weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form it can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, Robots, and living Creatures.

1st: When the wellspring wisp casts holographic image as a 1st-level spell, it produces a purely visual hologram at long range (400 feet + 40 feet/level). The image has no sound, smell, texture, or Temperature. The image can’t extend beyond four 10-foot cubes plus one 10-foot cube per caster level. The image lasts for as long as the wellspring wisp concentrates. The wellspring wisp can move the image within the limits of the size of the Effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzf8u9c-tCSaq2QUdJ_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes a single Creature to become confused for 1 round, making it unable to determine its actions. A confused Creature that is attacked automatically Attacks or attempts to Attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused Creature will not make Attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to Attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For a confused Creature that has not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of the affected creature’s turn each round to see what it does in that round.

D%	Behaviour
1-25	Act normally.
26-50	Do nothing but babble incoherently.
51-75	Deal 1d8 + Str Modifier damage to self with item in hand.
76-100	Attack nearest Creature.

A confused Creature that can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when Attacking a confused Target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfCNzKeRa819TcXa-_description
attribs.current:
A wellspring wisp creates up to four lights that resemble small headlights or flashlights. The dancing lights must stay within a 10-foot-radius area in relation to each other but otherwise move as the wellspring wisp desires: forward or back, up or down, straight or turning corners, or the like. The lights can move up to 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between the wellspring wisp and it exceeds the spell’s range.

The wellspring wisp can have only one dancing lights spell active at a time. If the wellspring wisp casts this spell while another casting is still in Effect, the previous casting is dispelled.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfDvDmq30SXJplBaN_target
attribs.current: One Humanoid Creature of CR 3 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKzfDvDmq30SXJplBaN_description
attribs.current: This spell short-circuits the mind of a Humanoid Creature with a CR of 3 or lower so that it is dazed (unable to take actions, but taking no penalty to AC). Humanoids of CR 4 or higher are not affected. After a Creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to it for 1 minute.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat The wisps turn invisible and use their wellspring song to lure their targets closer, casting holographic terrain to mislead them on their path.

During Combat If the player characters resist wandering into the wellspring, the wisps use their energy surge ability and attack at range.

Morale If reduced below 15 HP, a wisp flees into the fissure.

attribs.current: @{Radiation Drake Flight|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+16@{Radiation Drake Flight|engines_status}@{power_core_status}@{Radiation Drake Flight|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=Piloting  (5 ranks)}}

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUCZShiAfCFiOKPdON_description
attribs.current: All creatures in a starship that takes Hull Point damage from a radiation drake flight’s breath weapon are exposed to medium radiation (DC 17 Fortitude).

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUCZrLGsTCzmRSvNNa_description
attribs.current: The radiation drake flight is a mass of creatures so numerous it can function as a starship (and thus engage in starship combat). It has no crew, but can take engineer, gunner, and pilot actions (one of each, in the appropriate phases) using the bonuses, level, and ranks listed above. Modifiers for its size, speed, and manoeuvreability are already factored into its statistics. Use the following table to determine the effects when the drake flight takes critical damage.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUDHc0vhOZQcTK7Vwt_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a radiation drake flight can move up to its speed and end its movement in a hex containing an enemy starship or starship-scale creature, swarming over the hull and attempt a Piloting check with a DC equal to 15 + 1-1/2 × the enemy starship’s tier. On a success, the target takes a –2 penalty to Piloting checks and a –1 penalty to its speed on its next turn as it struggles to manoeuvre through the mob. Using this ability doesn’t trigger an attack from the enemy starship as normal for entering a hex with another starship.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-NKUC8Fq0YJmXZtulDrb_description
attribs.current:
Point (+8)
A weapon with this special property is always short range and can’t be fired against targets that are outside the first range increment. If a tracking weapon would hit a ship in an arc that contains a weapon with the point special property, the gunner of the targeted starship can attempt an immediate gunnery check with the point weapon against the incoming tracking projectile using the bonus listed in parentheses in the weapon’s Special entry (instead of her usual bonus to gunnery checks). The DC for this gunnery check is equal to 10 + the tracking weapon’s speed. If the attack hits, the tracking weapon is destroyed before it can damage the ship. A point weapon can be used to attempt only one such free gunnery check each round, but this usage potentially allows a point weapon to be fired twice in a single round.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUENqG2O94T9lEqm0c_description
attribs.current: Ayleth can share her adamantine toughness with her minions. Allied creatures within 2 hexes of Ayleth gain DV 4/adamantine and magic; this only reduces Hull Point damage and has no effect on Shield Point damage.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUEQqtpmrdthNKHpQP_description
attribs.current: Ayleth is so immense she can function as a starship (and thus engage in starship combat). She has no crew, but can take engineer, gunner, magic officer (Character Operations Manual 148), and pilot actions (one of each, in the appropriate phases) using the bonuses, level, and ranks listed above. Modifiers for her size, speed, and manoeuvreability are already factored into her statistics. Use the following table to determine the effects when Ayleth takes critical damage.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-NKUEtCIYEQeHR7noTuP_description
attribs.current: Ayleth can easily manoeuvre in flight. If she’s struck by an attack from a starship weapon, she can attempt a DC 30 Piloting check to take half damage. She can’t use this ability against tracking weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-NKUEHcOut3jzCZrL6il_description
attribs.current:
EMP
A weapon with this special property emits a beam of electromagnetic energy that does not deal damage to ships or shields, but plays havoc with a ship’s electronic systems. On a hit, an EMP weapon scrambles one of the target starship’s systems, determined randomly. This causes that system to act as if it had the glitching condition for 1d4 rounds. If the system is already damaged, instead increase its critical damage by one level of severity for 1d4 rounds. Whenever an EMP weapon scores critical damage, it scrambles two systems at random. Systems damaged by EMP weapons can be patched or repaired as normal. Functioning shields are unaffected by EMP weapons and completely block an EMP weapon’s effects.

attribs.name: feats
attribs.current: Improved Combat Manoeuvre (Sunder), Improved Combat Manoeuvre (Trip)

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Aspect Embodiment (Boundary), Aspect Insight (Boundary, Exergy), Celestial Radiance (5/Day), Entropic pool, Reactive 1/Day, Vanguard Disciplines (Blast Through, Entropic Charge)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Advanced Iridishell (Auto-Injector [Spell Ampoule of 2nd-level Mystic Cure, 3d8+6], Computer Interface, Phase Shield), Ambient Hardlight Hand Wrap with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Gelid Hail Pistol with 2 batteries (20 Charges each), Ferocity Blazon, Mk 1 Holding Gloves, Black Nanite Hypopen, Delectator

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Kurson stays close, engaging foes with his entropic strike. He attempts to use the hold person effect (DC 18) from his mk 1 holding gloves as a reaction against the first foe who strikes him in melee combat. He uses his entropic charge ability on opponents who are further away and attempts to trip those who seem vulnerable. If he’s reduced below 70 HP the computer interface in his armour activates his auto-injector with its mystic cure spell ampoule, healing him.

Morale Kurson is arrogant and can’t stand the thought he might be beaten. Still, like most bullies, he’s reluctant to die and attempts to retreat if reduced below 50 HP.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Commander Ceremonial Plate (Mk 1 Mobility Enhancer, Targeting Computer), LFD Blindmark Rifle with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), LFD Pulse Gauntlet with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Riot Grenades III (2), Efficient Bandolier, Purple Nanite Hypopen

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGKgoIaFQD4N4--WE_description
attribs.current: Ayleth’s elite forces train to emulate her ferocity. Any sonic weapon they wield gains the deafen critical hit effect, and any creature deafened by a critical hit is shaken for 1d4 rounds. If the creature is already shaken, they become frightened for 1d4 rounds instead.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Event 2: Unwelcoming Party (CR 11)
During Combat Mersall enforcers engage enemies at range, opening with their awesome cacophony attacks and spending Resolve Points to demoralize. They have their rifles set to deal nonlethal damage, as they want to capture the player characters alive. If cornered in melee, they attack with their pulse gauntlets.

Morale The enforcers follow Kurson’s lead, disengaging from combat only when he does.

Optional Event: Ambush! (CR 11)
During Combat See page 9.

Morale The enforcers don’t back down as long as Kurson lives; if he’s slain, an enforcer reduced below 30 HP attempts to flee to Mersall.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGGjcSGctE1-9K17Q_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a Mershall enforcer can make a single attack using a weapon that deals sonic damage or has the bright special property. After resolving the attack, as part of the full action the Mershall enforcer can attempt an Intimidate check to demoralize any one creature within 60 feet of them that the attack hit or damaged. The Mershall enforcer can spend 1 Resolve Point to instead attempt an Intimidate check to demoralize every creature within 60 feet of them that the attack hit or damaged.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGOK3IOX0j6yI2-39_description
attribs.current: The shock and awe fighting style excels at overwhelming enemies senses with overpowering auditory and visual stimuli. A Mershall enforcer can modify their weapons to issue thunderous booms or blazing flashes of light, at the same time mitigating these effects with regard to your own senses. This style is strongest with weapons that deal sonic damage or that affect an area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGQQ4aYEisUwPPRaH_description
attribs.current: A Mershall enforcer gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against effects that would blind or deafen them. Any weapon the Mershall enforcer wields that has the powered weapon special property or that uses ammunition gains the bright weapon special property; they can activate or deactivate this ability as a swift or move action. Bright weapons the Mershall enforcer wields gain the blind critical hit effect or the deafen critical hit effect. If the Mershall enforcer's bright weapon already has a critical hit effect, when they score a critical hit, they apply either the weapon’s normal critical hit effect, the blind critical hit effect, or the deafen critical hit effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGMqBqJEw9hIG1GGM_description
attribs.current: A Mershall enforcer has a preferred fighting style that represents the type of soldier they are. Each fighting style is composed of various style techniques that the Mershall enforcer learns as they gain experience.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGIxmUtIadPOekVsE_description
attribs.current: When a Mershall enforcer hits a creature within 30 feet of them while using a weapon with the bright weapon special property, the radiance partially blinds the target, giving it the dazzled condition for 1 round. If the Mershall enforcer hits multiple creatures at the same time (such as with an automatic, blast, or explode weapon), only the creature nearest to them or at the centre of the explosion (their choice if multiple creatures are equidistant) is affected.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKUGSCLoEDP5w0kRVmk_description
attribs.current: When a Mershall enforcer hits a creature within 30 feet of them using a weapon in the sonic category, the sonic energy continues to resonate within that creature, giving it the flat-footed condition for 1 round. If the Mershall enforcer hits multiple creatures at the same time (such as with an automatic, blast, or explode weapon), only the creature nearest to them or to the centre of the explosion (their choice if multiple creatures are equidistant) is affected.

attribs.name: vehicle_dimensions
attribs.current: 10 ft. long, 10 ft. wide,  10 ft. high

attribs.name: repeating_vehicle-systems_-NKaZnGjF-1zlbj99b3P_description
attribs.current: Once the vehicle becomes broken, its engine explodes in 1d4 rounds (even if it’s been wrecked), dealing 1d6 fire damage in a 10-foot burst around the vehicle; this damage increases to 3d6 for anyone riding the vehicle. At 3rd level and every odd level thereafter, the burst deals an additional 1d6 damage (or an additional 2d6 damage to riders). Creatures can take half damage with a successful Reflex save (DC = the vehicle’s collision DC).

attribs.name: repeating_vehicle-modifications_-NLsLHODBC8ppQFQDn0Y_description
attribs.current:
This secret compartment hidden within the vehicle can store a relatively small supply of contraband. A Medium vehicle’s smuggler’s compartment can hold 1 bulk of gear, and the compartment’s capacity triples for each vehicle size category larger than Medium (maximum 81 bulk for a Colossal vehicle). A creature must succeed at a Perception check to detect the compartment, or succeed at a Computers check if using sensors to scan the vehicle. The DC of these checks is based on the compartment’s model.

Check DCs to detect the compartment are 22.

attribs.name: repeating_vehicle-modifications_-NLsLLp3CKZHP1ZC8okP_description
attribs.current: When activated as a move action, this modification emits dense fog, smoke, or steam from the rear of the vehicle, enshrouding pursuers in a cloudy haze. While the modification is active, it creates an obscuring cloud that fills an area twice as wide as the vehicle’s space in any space the vehicle leaves. This cloud grants concealment, and the cloud in any space dissipates automatically after 1 round. While its smoke screen is active, the vehicle grants its pilot a +1 circumstance bonus to Piloting checks made to evade or trick. Although this modification can be installed in a water vehicle, it has no effect underwater.

attribs.name: vehicle_dimensions
attribs.current: 10 ft. wide, 10 ft. long,  4 ft. high

attribs.name: repeating_vehicle-modifications_-NLsLYoLSGjodx7gQfRB_description
attribs.current:
A vehicle with this modification allows a creature in the vehicle to perceive their surroundings using an additional sense based on the modification’s model.

The vehicle’s occupants can perceive using darkvision with a range of 120 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_vehicle-modifications_-NLsLdprsvBnO0kktOcJ_description
attribs.current:
The grav-nav system harnesses gravitational fields to smooth the ride for passengers of this vehicle. This increases the vehicle’s attack modifier. The amount depends on the grav-nav type, as listed below.

Increase attack modifier by +1.

attribs.current:
+2 enhancement to armor
+2 enhancement to attack|section:attack
+2 enhancement to damage|section:attack

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Islea takes cover. She uses target tracking each round, focusing on shooting one veolisk at a time.

Morale Islea won’t abandon her new allies.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKabj5V61M6Hwzh3AjA_description
attribs.current: A veolisk embodies the claustrophobic, dark, and often maddening aspects of deep space, and it can project a sliver of the void into its enemies with its mere gaze. A creature that fails a DC 16 Will saving throw against this gaze ability is confused until the beginning of its next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The veolisks use void gaze against as many foes as possible.

Morale If reduced below 20 HP a veolisk flees.

attribs.current: Freebooter ArmoUr II, Electromagnetic radshot with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges), Swagger Handcannon with 12 Shells, Tactical Retractable Spike, Hogback

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKacXkqhrKTJg0IZyCD_description
attribs.current: A Tachritan ghost scout can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, the ghost scout can move up to their speed. Whether or not the ghost scout moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making the ghost scout's attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with their specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their target’s CR. If the ghost scout succeeds at the check, they deal 3d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. The ghost scout can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKacW8eowdVPHh2QjCI_description
attribs.current: When a Tachritan ghost scout succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. The Tachritan ghost scout might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKadOeXVZJ1KIP53ttt_description
attribs.current: 2d8 F on the first round, increases by 1d8 every round thereafter; Fortitude DC 19 half; multiple targets (all creatures in room)

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Darkvision 60 ft., Low-Light Vision, Sense Through (Vision [Smoke Only])

attribs.name: offensive_abilities
attribs.current: breath weapon (30 ft. cone, 12d6 E&F, DC 13 Reflex, usable every 1d4 rounds), vent

attribs.name: environment
attribs.current: Warm and Temperate Mountains and Underground

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWMe8upjYcpoMLVlxZ_description
attribs.current: As a move action, or in place of making a bite attack when using multiattack, an ignurso can forcefully exhale a 20-foot-radius cloud of choking smoke centred on itself. Non-ignursos in or entering the area are sickened for 1 round (Fortitude DC 18 negates), and the cloud otherwise functions as fog cloud with a duration of 1d6 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKaeneWrZMqXUtZVbua_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a ignurso can exhale a cone or line of energy or another magical effect. A breath weapon attack usually deals damage, and it’s often energy-based. A breath weapon usually allows a target to attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage, though some breath weapons require a successful Fortitude or Will save instead. the ignurso is immune to its own breath weapon and the breath weapons of others of its kind unless otherwise noted. Each breath weapon also indicates how often it can be used.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKafesmslYqXxVTDIOd_description
attribs.current: When a noqual golem takes damage that reduces it to half its maximum Hit Points or fewer, it must attempt a DC 18 Will save. While at or below half HP, it must also attempt a DC 18 Will save whenever it takes additional damage. On a failure, the golem goes berserk. While berserk, the golem uses its actions to make a full attack, or to move and attack. If it can’t reach a creature, it attacks objects. The golem can attempt a DC 18 Will save at the end of each of its turns to end the berserk state. If the golem’s creator communicates with the golem to calm it (via comm unit or from within 60 feet) and succeeds at a DC 10 Charisma check, the golem receives a +2 circumstance bonus to this save.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKafnowDZakP2G5RoRM_description
attribs.current: A golem can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKafrh3NXTEQmxrtRhr_description
attribs.current: On a critical hit, the noqual golem dispels a magical effect on the target as if with a targeted dispel magic. If the target has more than one magical effect active, the effect dispelled is determined randomly.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKafwETwA4ksNNMsvjr_description
attribs.current:
A noqual golem is immune to any spell or spell-like ability that allows spell resistance, unless the spell specifically lists constructs in its Targets entry. In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against the golem, as follows.
If targeted with dispel magic, the clashing attempts to dampen magical energies cancel out, and the golem loses its dispelling touch and spelldrain aura for 3 rounds (no save). If the caster also succeeds at a caster level check against the DC of the golem’s aura, the golem also loses its immunity to magic for 1 round.
A spell dealing force damage gives the golem the benefit of haste for 1 round, and it regains 2d8 Hit Points per damage die of the spell. If the amount of healing would cause the golem to exceed its maximum Hit Points, it gains any excess as temporary Hit Points.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKag9EetWLhjU26alAb_description
attribs.current: The golem’s noqual weakens magic cast around it. A creature attempting to cast a spell within the golem’s aura must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or treat the spell as 1 caster level lower for the purposes of duration, range, and effects such as damage or healing.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKag9EetWLhjU26alAb_target
attribs.current: All Creatures Attempting to Cast a Spell

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Animated Advanced Iridishell|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Animated Advanced Iridishell|engines_status}@{Animated Advanced Iridishell|power_core_status}@{Animated Advanced Iridishell|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Drake Dragon Pistol with 20 Petrol Canisters, Microserrated Longsword, Deflective Reinforcement, Jetpack, Mk 1 Thermal Capacitor

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKah7SbdWpYLj9pU7t4_description
attribs.current: An animated advanced iridishell can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Akitonian, Castrovelian, Common, Eoxian, Kasatha, Shirren, Triaxian, Vercite, Ysoki; Telepathy 100 ft.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKahwZ2QBLLuP-OwhPP_description
attribs.current: When a virtual phantom is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it discorporates into a stream of perceptible computer code and attempts to escape to the last computer it possessed. If it doesn’t reach its destination within 1 hour, the virtual phantom is completely destroyed. Additional damage dealt to a virtual phantom in this form has no effect, but neither does its fast healing take effect. Once it reaches the computer, the virtual phantom begins healing again. A signal jammer with a level equal to or greater than the virtual phantom’s CR prevents the creature from moving while in code form.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKai-j59Vso2Pl3S93J_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a virtual phantom can emit an electrical surge with a range of 60 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKai3jDM5L0K1ZU3Wis_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a virtual phantom can merge with a computer it touches, granting it complete control over anything that computer governs. The virtual phantom is fully subsumed into the computer and can use or manipulate any of the programs and information on the machine. If the computer is on a starship involved in starship combat, the virtual phantom can act in place of a single crew member each round. A virtual phantom can deliver its shocking touch attack through the display or input device connected to a computer it is possessing. A virtual phantom can voluntarily leave a possessed computer as another full action, or a creature can force it out with a successful Computers check (DC = 10 + the virtual phantom’s total Computers bonus) as a full action; in either case, the virtual phantom manifests in a square adjacent to the computer.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKai7msmtnxeQMWx1y0_description
attribs.current: In addition to taking half again as much damage when it takes positive energy damage, a virtual phantom is affected by effects that bypass the DR and energy resistance of undead creatures, such as weapons with the disruptive fusion.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Fighting Styles (Qi Adept), Gather Qi, Gear Boosts (Nimble Juggernaut), Qi Strike

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Lashunta Ringwear II, Static Arc Rifle with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), Warfan, Stickybomb Grenades II (2)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
F1. Unwound Passage (CR 11)
During Combat The hesper guards open fire with their static arc rifles, setting them to stun to capture the intruders for questioning. They spend a Resolve Point to gather qi for their plasma blasts to target foes within range. If cornered, they use jolting surge and spend another Resolve Point to for qi flight, attempting to retreat up the stairs.

Morale If a hesper guard is reduced below 30 HP, they signal a tactical retreat, moving into area F2 and calling for reinforcements. If they can’t retreat, they surrender.

F3. Hespers' Hideout (CR 11)
During Combat The hesper guards open fire with their static arc rifles, setting them to stun to capture the intruders for questioning. They spend a Resolve Point to gather qi for their plasma blasts to target foes within range. If cornered, they use jolting surge and spend another Resolve Point to for qi flight, attempting to retreat up the stairs.

Morale The hespers surrender if Jacaren is slain; otherwise, they fight to the death to defend their leader.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZwBHWYXUMZLxKW_description
attribs.current: A hesper touches a target with a device they're holding that uses electricity requiring a melee attack against the target's EAC. Alternatively the hesper can instead touch an electrical device a target is wearing (or a target that is an electrical device such as a robot) with their hand gaining a +2 bonus to their attack roll. Either way if the hesper's attack hits the electrical device surges out of control dealing 4d6 electricity damage to your target. Casting this spell doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZyP8vCTOLANHJZ_description
attribs.current: A hesper collect the heat generated by nearby bodies and devices and vent it outward in a thermal wave dealing 2d8 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ-gFfHNpZtEBJM_description
attribs.current: When a hesper casts this spell choose acid cold electricity or fire; the spell gains that descriptor. The hesper fires a ray at the target and they must make a ranged attack against its EAC. On a hit the ray deals 1d3 damage of the chosen energy type.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ0oEljziwCXuKA_description
attribs.current: This spell repairs damaged objects and constructs restoring 1d4 Hit Points. If the object has the broken condition this condition is removed if the object is restored to at least half its original Hit Points. All of the pieces of an object must be present for this spell to function. A construct can benefit from this spell only once per day. Magic items can be repaired by this spell but magic items that are destroyed don't have their magic abilities restored. This spell doesn't reverse effects that warp or otherwise transmute items but it can still repair damage dealt to such items.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ0oEljziwCXuKA_target
attribs.current: One object of up to 1 bulk

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ0oEljziwCXuKB_description
attribs.current: A hesper detects radiation in the surrounding area and they can determine the specific intensity of the radiation of one area or object within the spell's area each round without taking an action (see Radiation on page 403 for more details). The spell can penetrate barriers but 3 feet of dirt or wood 1 foot of stone 1 inch of common metal a thin sheet of lead or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ11HZxVeRtqu4x_description
attribs.current:
A hesper can deliver an enormous dose of radiation with a touch, triggering sudden mutations and pain in living creatures. With a successful attack against a living creature's KAC, a hesper causes the target to sprout tumors that erupt at the beginning of its next turn, causing a random mutation (roll 1d20 on the table on page 63) that persists for 24 hours. An affected creature can negate this transformation with a successful DC 13 Fortitude saving throw. Once a creature has been affected by a hesper's mutating touch, it becomes immune to that particular fey's mutating touch for 24 hours.

Mutating touch
d20        Mutation        Effect
1        Additional eyes        Target gains light blindness and a +4 bonus to sight-based Perception checks
2–3        Autonomous parasite        Target takes 1d6 slashing damage as a parasite emerges
4–5        Bioelectric cells        Technological items held by the target gain the broken condition for as long as the target holds them
6–7        Claws, spines, or teeth on one limb        Target gains a natural melee attack that deals 1d3+Str piercing damage for Medium creatures, but it takes a –2 penalty to attacks with two-handed weapons
8–9        Glowing tumors        Target sheds light as a lantern and takes a –5 penalty to Stealth checks
10        Gills        Target gains the amphibious ability, but takes a –2 penalty to Fortitude saving throws
11        Hypertrichosis         Target gains a +1 bonus to its AC, but the max Dex bonus of armor it wears decreases by 1
12–13        Musk gland        Target gains a 30-foot aura that nauseates living creatures within it (Fortitude DC = 10 + half the target’s level or CR + the target’s Con modifier)
14–15        Secondary ears        Target gains vulnerability to sonic damage and a +4 bonus to hearing-based Perception checks 
16–17        Vestigial limb        Target grows a useless extra limb that imparts a –2 penalty to Dexterity-based skill checks
18–19        Weeping sores        Target takes a –2 penalty to Charisma-based skill checks
20        Wracking pain        Target is sickened

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ11HZxVeRtqu4y_description
attribs.current: If a hesper spends 1 hour in close contact with a starship's power core or another large power source (such as a fusion reactor), it can form a long-term bond. A hesper can merge with its bonded reactor, gaining fast healing 5 while it remains merged. A merged hesper is aware of what happens in the reactor's immediate vicinity, but if the reactor is broken or suffers the wrecked critical damage condition, the hesper is immediately expelled and takes 3d6 damage. If the reactor is destroyed while the hesper is merged with it, the hesper is slain instantly (Fortitude DC 15 negates). A hesper can bond with only one reactor at a time, and forming a new bond severs its previous bond.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Cache Capacitor 1 (Unseen Servant), Magic Hacks (Glitch Step, Tech Countermeasures), Spell Cache (Mk 1 Improvisation Adornment)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: D-Suit III, Refraction Perforator Pistol with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), Ultrathin Switchblade, Mk 1 Improvisation Adornment, Tier 2 Datapad (Containing a Logic Bomb)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat If the heroes attack Jacaren, he responds in kind. He opens combat with irradiate since he and the other hespers are immune. He then uses microbot assault and slow; if cornered, he casts jolting surge and overheat.

Morale Jacaren attempts to surrender if reduced below 40 HP, on the condition that his opponents leave the others unharmed; otherwise, he fights to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZwBHWYXUMZLxKW_description
attribs.current: Jacaren touches a target with a device he's holding that uses electricity requiring a melee attack against the target's EAC. Alternatively Jacaren can instead touch an electrical device a target is wearing (or a target that is an electrical device such as a robot) with his hand gaining a +2 bonus to your attack roll. Either way if Jacaren's attack hits the electrical device surges out of control dealing 4d6 electricity damage to his target. Casting this spell doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWNZZ11HZxVeRtqu4y_description
attribs.current: If Jacaren spends 1 hour in close contact with a starship's power core or another large power source (such as a fusion reactor), he can form a long-term bond. Jacaren can merge with his bonded reactor, gaining fast healing 5 while he remains merged. A merged Jacaren is aware of what happens in the reactor's immediate vicinity, but if the reactor is broken or suffers the wrecked critical damage condition, Jacaren is immediately expelled and takes 3d6 damage. If the reactor is destroyed while Jacaren is merged with it, he is slain instantly (Fortitude DC 15 negates).
