attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8Z0e-gwdpqPVCSZNK_target
attribs.current: Up to Three Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 15 ft. Apart; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8Z0e-gwdpqPVCSZNK_description
attribs.current:
Jacaren fires two Missiles of magical energy that strike Targets unerringly (the Creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 force damage each. Jacaren can’t Target specific parts of a Creature, and objects are not damaged by the spell.

Jacaren can Target a single Creature or several Creatures, but each missile can strike only one Creature. Jacaren must designate Targets before you attempt to overcome Spell Resistance or roll damage.

Jacaren can cast this spell as a Full Action. If Jacaren does, he fires three Missiles instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YywkXOq3x2H6Y102_description
attribs.current:
Jacaren detects all Technological Items (even hybrid items) with Charges or that replenish Charges in the area, including batteries, power cells, and generators (as well as such items that are on Creatures you can see, even if the Creatures have hidden those items on themselves). Jacaren can’t determine if there are Technological Items in areas he can’t see, nor can he detect technological traps in this way.

The information this spell provides allows Jacaren to differentiate between charged items and items that replenish Charges, but it does not provide any further information nor does it tell him, for Example, how many Charges an item currently has or how many maximum Charges it can hold. This spell can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of Common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8Yv1Ds6DEXeYdZTA9_description
attribs.current: Jacaren restores up to 10 Charges to a Battery or 5 Charges to a Technological Item capable of being charged by a Battery. Since this spell takes Jacaren's Personal energy, he must spend 1 Resolve Point to cast it. If Jacaren recharges a Battery, there is a 20% ([[1d100]]%) chance the Battery is destroyed by the attempt. If Jacaren restores more Charges than the item can hold, the item must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw or take 1d6 electricity damage for each excess Charge. This spell provides no knowledge of how many Charges an item can safely hold, but Jacaren can choose to bestow fewer Charges than the maximum allowed to reduce the risk; he must declare how many Charges he is restoring before casting this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YspLyQVMlikuZPm7_description
attribs.current:
Jacaren pulls latent technological energy from the air to form a cloud of fist-sized hindering microbots that fill an area he designates. The microbots begin in a 10-foot-square area when Jacaren creates them, and he can create the cloud so that it shares the space of other Creatures. If no Creatures are within the cloud’s area, the microbots pursue and harass the nearest Creature that is Hostile to Jacaren as best they can each round. Although the microbots generally know which Creatures are your enemies, Jacaren has no Control over their Targets or direction of Travel. If there are multiple valid Targets the microbots can harass, the cloud will split into a maximum of four 5-foot-square segments and pursue different Targets.

The cloud (and any segments thereof) has a fly speed of 20 feet. Each round on Jacaren's turn, the microbot cloud grants Harrying Fire against the foes in its spaces. In addition, the cloud grants Covering Fire to anyone attacked by foes in its spaces. The microbots constantly repair themselves and the cloud generates new microbots every few seconds, so any Attack against them is essentially ineffective.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YrFQWSHsGvUwMmGW_target
attribs.current: One Object of Up to 9 Bulks or One Construct of Any Size

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YrFQWSHsGvUwMmGW_description
attribs.current:
This spell repairs damaged objects and constructs, restoring 5d6 Hit Points. If the Object has the Broken condition, this condition is removed if the Object is restored to at least half its original Hit Points. All of the pieces of an Object must be present for this spell to function. A Construct can benefit from this spell only once per day.

Make whole can fix destroyed Magic Items, and it restores the magic properties of the item if your Technomancer level is at least twice the item’s level. Items with Charges (such as batteries) and single-use items (such as potions and grenades) can’t be repaired in this way. When you cast make whole on a Construct, the spell bypasses any immunity to magic as if the spell did not allow Spell Resistance.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YpkAK2oeL0RGz7KN_description
attribs.current:
Jacaren infuses one Computer System or module with protective energy, inuring it against attempts to Access it.

As long as this spell is in Effect, the first time a Creature unsuccessfully attempts to Access, destroy, or manipulate the affected Computer System or module (using the Computers skill or otherwise), it takes 6d6 damage (either cold, electricity, or fire damage; Jacaren chooses when casting the spell, and the spell gains the appropriate descriptor). The Creature can attempt a Fortitude saving throw for half damage, and Spell Resistance applies. This damage is in addition to any negative effects the Creature suffers due to the system’s other countermeasures.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YlpUJFMAVWcvYt7b_target
attribs.current: Up to 0 Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8YlpUJFMAVWcvYt7b_description
attribs.current: An affected Creature moves and Attacks at a drastically slowed rate. Creatures affected by this spell are staggered and can take only a single Move Action or Standard action each turn, but not both, and it can’t take full actions. A slowed Creature moves at half its Normal speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment). Multiple slow effects don’t stack. Slow counters and Negates haste.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NL8Yk9a-nXG6ydg9w7P_description
attribs.current: This spell floods the area of Effect with dangerous radiation. The Strength of the radiation you create depends on your caster level, as detailed below. The central irradiated area is always a 10-foot-radius Spread that expands normally per the rules for radiation areas of Effect. Creatures within the area are exposed to the radiation only once; the radiation does not linger in the area. The saving throw to resist the radiation effects is set by the spell rather than the Standard save DC for radiation.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsight (Vibration) 60 ft., Darkvision 120 ft., Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Ayleth-MK-2 opens combat with her breath weapon. She flies near the ceiling when possible, using her ranged weapons first before swooping into melee.

Morale Fanatical in fulfilling her duties, Ayleth-MK-2 fights until destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWO9j10FGOIm6TZ6OU_description
attribs.current: Ayleth-Mk-2 can fire laser beams from her mouth, eyes, or wingtips. This attack has a range increment of 100 feet, targets EAC, and has the burn critical hit effect that lists a number of d6s equal to one quarter their level (minimum 1). The attack also has the sniper weapon special property with a range of 1,000 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NJWO9j22svu9WNUwsZt_description
attribs.current: For effects targeting creatures by type, Ayleth-Mk-2 count as both dragons and constructs (whichever allows an ability to affect them for abilities that affect only one of those types, and whichever is worse for abilities that affect both types). Ayleth-Mk-2 receives a +2 racial bonus to saving throws against disease, mind-affecting effects, and poison unless those effects specifically target constructs. Additionally, she is protected from environmental effects as if wearing armour (of an item level equal to the dragon’s CR) with its environmental protection active.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Skeleton Crew|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Skeleton Crew|engines_status}@{Skeleton Crew|power_core_status}@{Skeleton Crew|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Estex Suit III, Ominous Scrapper-Class Crisis Wrench, Fighter Handcoil with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKamFWOcbOa3Mtw9qgm_description
attribs.current: Betrayed by a leader in whom they once believed, the skeleton crew radiates an aura of distrust. Creatures who fail their Will saves against the aura of betrayal can’t aid another, benefit from flanking, or count as anyone’s ally for the purposes of spells or other effects as long as they remain in the aura.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKamH5mKLXEh0v7WDHZ_description
attribs.current: Though the skeleton crew is mindless, they can instinctually utilize their training. As a standard action, a skeleton crew can attempt to sabotage a weapon or armour of an adjacent creature with a DC 25 Engineering check. On a success, the item is treated as broken. A creature can fix the sabotaged item with a DC 25 Engineering check as a standard action.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKamvDA9ezP435RFahN_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a skeleton crew can scream a wordless howl of rage, targeting all creatures who can hear it within 30 feet. This deals 5d6 sonic damage and 1d6 bleed damage as affected creatures begin bleeding from the ears. A successful DC 17 Fortitude save halves the damage and negates the bleed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKamvDA9ezP435RFahN_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Takes [[1d6]] Bleed Damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKanP0GZLZ1FGFGeYfO_description
attribs.current: energy drain, 1 level, DC 17 Will to resist initial energy drain, DC 17 Fortitude to remove negative level; all non–Shadow Plane native creatures in area G3

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6SSks83ZfmF0VYjia_description
attribs.current: The shifting patterns on Syla’s wings are hypnotic. A creature that starts its turn able to see the Syla must succeed at a DC 16 Will saving throw or become confused for 1 round. A creature can avoid looking directly at Syla to gain a +4 bonus to the saving throw. However, doing so causes the creature to treat the Syla as if it has concealment (20% miss chance). Gloomwings and tenebrous worms are immune to this effect. This is a mind-affecting, sense-dependent effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6Sqyv4jX2tfyFIxJD_description
attribs.current: As a full action, Syla can lay eggs in a Small or larger helpless living creature. The target creature contracts tenebrous gestation (see below).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6Sqyv4jX2tfyFIxJD_target
attribs.current: One Small or Larger Helpless Living Creature

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6T3ZsQYwpJsOletZi_description
attribs.current: Starting on the round after Syla becomes agitated (typically the second round of combat), the creature exudes an invisible cloud of weakening pheromones that creates a musky scent. Living creatures other than gloomwings and tenebrous worms within this 30-foot aura must succeed at a DC 13 Fortitude saving throw or become fatigued for 1 hour.

attribs.name: race
attribs.current: Advanced gloomwing (Starfinder Adventure Path #10: The Diaspora Strain 56)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat: The tenebrous worms aren’t clever enough to work in tandem and end up attacking different PCs.

Morale: The hungry worms fight to the death.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Tenebrous Worm Hatchlings|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Tenebrous Worm Hatchlings|engines_status}@{Tenebrous Worm Hatchlings|power_core_status}@{Tenebrous Worm Hatchlings|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU69ZG4devREkOIYDow_description
attribs.current: This acid deals [[3d6]] acid damage in dim light, [[2d6]] acid damage in normal light, and [[1d6]] acid damage in bright light or darkness.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6YZROFwf8wPO7cTFz_effect
attribs.current: Take [[1d4]] Piercing Damage and be Exposed to the Tenebrous Worm Poison.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MU6YZROFwf8wPO7cTFz_description
attribs.current: Bristles of shadow extend from between the tenebrous worm’s armoured plates. Each time a creature within 10 feet of the worm attacks it, several of these bristles reactively shoot off at the attacker. The attacker must succeed at a DC 16 Reflex save or take 1d4 piercing damage and be exposed to tenebrous worm poison (see below). An attacker that strikes the worm with an unarmed strike or grapples the worm is automatically damaged and exposed to the poison.

attribs.name: race
attribs.current: Unique yurei (Starfinder Adventure Path #39: The Gilded Cage 61)

attribs.name: organization
attribs.current: Solitary or Haunt (1 Yurei plus 2-4 Ghosts)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsIL4IwdVjbXIZ6kqJ_description
attribs.current: As a full action, Azrikaris can expose his face to a single adjacent creature. That creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or be stunned for 1d6 rounds. A target that is stunned must also succeed at a DC 21 Fortitude save or immediately be reduced to 0 Hit Points and begin dying (the target doesn’t lose any Stamina Points it might have had). A target that succeeds at the initial saving throw is immune to that particular yurei’s face of death ability for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect, and the secondary effect is a death effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsIO2bH6Ifs8uvIUez_description
attribs.current: Each yurei has a bond with an object that was significant to it in life, such as a datapad or comm unit. As long as a yurei and its focus are both on the same plane of existence, a yurei can observe its focus, as per clairaudience/clairvoyance; travel to its focus, as per interplanetary teleport; and use any of its spell-like abilities as if it was in the same space as its focus, all regardless of distance.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsIQuUVZ-wIXbSzary_description
attribs.current: A creature that takes damage from Azrikaris’s painful grasp attack must succeed at a DC 21 Will saving throw or take a –2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for 1 round. This is a pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHo4Z4n-I6kh7VRp8_target
attribs.current: Azrikaris and Touched Objects or Touched Willing or Unconscious Creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHo4Z4n-I6kh7VRp8_description
attribs.current:
Azrikaris instantly transfers himself from his current location to any other spot within range. Azrikaris always arrives at exactly the spot desired—whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating its direction. Azrikaris can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed his maximum load. Azrikaris can also bring up to four additional willing or unconscious Medium or smaller Creatures (carrying gear or objects up to their maximum load) or their equivalent. A Large Creature counts as two Medium Creatures, and a Huge Creature counts as two Large Creatures. All Creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those Creatures must be in contact with Azrikaris. After using this spell, Azrikaris can’t take any Other Actions until his next turn (and each Creature travelling with Azrikaris can’t take any Other Actions until its next turn).

If Azrikaris arrives in a place that is already occupied by a solid body, he and each Creature travelling with him each take [[1d6]] (1d6) damage and are shunted to a random open space on a suitable surface within 100 feet of the intended location. If there is no free space within 100 feet, Azrikaris and each Creature travelling with him take [[2d6]] (2d6) additional damage and are shunted to a free space within 1,000 feet. If there is no free space within 1,000 feet, Azrikaris and each Creature travelling with him take [[4d6]] (4d6) additional damage and the spell simply fails.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHpiooomQYY5DbwwZ_description
attribs.current:
With a single mental nudge, Azrikaris can unlock one or more targets’ deepest nightmares. A Target that succeeds at its Will saving throw against this spell is Shaken for 1 round.

When Azrikaris casts fear as 4th-level spell, it affects all living Creatures in 30-foot cone-shaped burst regardless of CR. Each Target must succeed at a Will save or become Panicked for 1 minute. If cornered, a Panicked Creature begins Cowering.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHsJ3T3KeGMRkO2wM_description
attribs.current:
Azrikaris places a terrible curse on the Target, stealing either its overall competency or its ability to think and act on its feet. Choose one of the following. 

The Target takes a –4 penalty to Ability Checks, Attack rolls, saving throws, and Skill Checks. 
Each turn, the Target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.

Azrikaris can also invent his own curse (see Afflictions for a few ideas), but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break Enchantment, Miracle, Remove Affliction, or wish spell.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke Attacks of opportunity. Bestow curse counters Remove Affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHuBWd7KSnpIpY1SJ_description
attribs.current: The Target of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The Creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total Concealment. Unlike actual total Concealment, displacement doesn’t prevent enemies from targeting the Creature normally. True Seeing reveals the target’s true location and Negates the miss chance. If a Creature with blindsense can also see the displaced Creature, the visual and blindsense information combined are enough for the Creature with blindsense to Attack the displaced Creature without a miss chance, unlike Normal for blindsense.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHvaEIqcEMeGjyECU_description
attribs.current:
Azrikaris weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form he can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, Robots, and living Creatures.

When Azrikaris casts holographic image as a 3rd-level spell, it produces a hologram as per the 1st-level version of the spell, except the hologram can include sound, smell, and thermal illusions (but not speech). The image disappears when it is struck by an Opponent, unless you cause the hologram to react appropriately. The image lasts for as long as Azrikaris concentrates plus 3 additional rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHxabwaFumlWEallp_description
attribs.current: Azrikaris precisely identifies a target, such as by name or via a material connection like a personal possession or lock of its hair. The spell fails without expending a spell slot if the target isn’t asleep or in a resting state similar to sleep. If Azrikaris's never met the target in person and lack a material connection to the target, the target gains a +5 bonus to the saving throw. If the spell works, the target remains resting for 1 minute, then has a nightmare, rouses, and becomes frightened for [[2d6]] (2d6) rounds. The target can’t willingly reenter the affected resting state for 1 hour. To do so after this time has elapsed, the target must succeed at the saving throw again. If this save fails, the target can try again once per hour thereafter. After 24 hours have passed, this restless state ends.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsHzfSLXcRtxhn22EU_description
attribs.current:
Azrikaris creates a volume of sound that rises, falls, recedes, approaches, or remains fixed. Azrikaris chooses what type of sound this spell creates when casting it and cannot thereafter change the sound’s basic character.

The volume of sound created can produce as much noise as 20 Normal Humans. Thus, Azrikaris can create shouting, singing, talking, marching, running, or walking sounds, as well as sounds of battle or small explosions. Azrikaris can make noises that sound like machines, the general chatter of distant conversation, or the roar of an alien predator, but he can’t make specific sounds such as intelligible Speech or the exact hum of a particular starship’s engines.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsI06NHJOdLcEnfnQO_target
attribs.current: One Creature or Object No More than 120 Bulks

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsI06NHJOdLcEnfnQO_description
attribs.current:
The Creature or Object touched becomes Invisible. If the Target is a Creature, any gear it is carrying vanishes as well. If you cast the spell on someone else, neither you nor your allies can see the Target unless you can normally see Invisible things or you employ magic to do so.

The spell ends if the Target Attacks any Creature. For purposes of this spell, an Attack includes any spell or harmful Effect targeting a foe or whose area or Effect includes a foe. Actions directed at unattended objects don’t break the spell. Spells that specifically affect allies but not foes are not Attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area. Causing harm indirectly is not an Attack. Thus, an Invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon Security forces and have them Attack, start a trash compactor with foes inside, remotely trigger traps, and so forth.

attribs.name: save_notes
attribs.current: +2 vs. Disease, Mind-Affecting Effects, Poison, and Sleep

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Access Akashic Record, Peer into the Future, Telepathic Memories

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Freebooter Armour IV, Ultracold Hail Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Zero-Edge Switchblade, Pearly White Spindle Aeon Stone, Tier 3 Datapad; Augmentations Accelerated Datajack

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsNAp8qJdVwncPtnu6_description
attribs.current:
Speaker-10 gains Access to the target’s memories and knowledge, and they can pry the information they want from them involuntarily.

Speaker-10 can attempt to learn the answer to one question of theirchoice per round; after each question, the Target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the Creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 19. If it fails its Bluff check, Speaker-10 gains the answer you desire. If it succeeds at its check, Speaker-10 gains no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and Speaker-10 believes that wrong answer to be the truth. Speaker-10's questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into their mind. Speaker-10 and the Target don’t need to speak the same language, though less intelligent Creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to their questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsNFrHqRvQLuxcOQG4_description
attribs.current: Speaker-10 links their mind to that of a touched creature to swiftly communicate a large amount of complex information in an instant. Speaker-10 decides what the target learns, limited to any amount of information that otherwise could be communicated in 10 minutes. This information comes in a series of visual images and emotional sensations, and it isn’t language dependent.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNL-A9lJd1wKZUr-b_description
attribs.current:
Speaker-10 sends their mind to another plane of existence (an Elemental Plane or some plane further removed) in order to receive advice and information from powers there. The powers reply in a language Speaker-10 understands, but they resent such contact and give only brief answers to Speaker-10's questions. All questions are answered with “Yes,” “No,” “Maybe,” “Never,” “Irrelevant,” or some other one-word answer.

Speaker-10 must concentrate on maintaining the spell in order to ask questions at the rate of one per round. A question is answered by the power during the same round. Speaker-10 can ask one question for every 2 caster levels. On rare occasions, this Divination may be blocked by an act of certain deities or forces.

Contacting a minor Planar power is relatively safe but may not result in useful answers. For each question Speaker-10 asks, the GM secretly rolls 1d20.

1–2: The power gives Speaker-10 no answer, the spell ends, and they must attempt a DC 7 Intelligence check. On a failed check, Speaker-10's Intelligence and Charisma scores each fall to 8 for a week and they are unable to cast Spells for that period.

3–5: Speaker-10 receives a random answer to the question.

6–10: Speaker-10 receives an incorrect answer to the question. Based on the nature and needs of the Creature contacted, this may be a lie designed to harm Speaker-10.

11–15: Speaker-10 receives no answer to the question.

16 or More: Speaker-10 receives a truthful and useful one-word answer. If the question can’t be truthfully answered in this way, no answer is received.

Contact with minds further removed from Speaker-10's home plane increases the probability that they will incur a decrease in Intelligence and Charisma due to their brain being overwhelmed by the power’s sheer strangeness and force, but it also increases the chance of the power knowing the answer and answering correctly. Speaker-10 can add any value from +1 to +5 to the d20 roll to represent contacting increasingly powerful Planar beings. However, on a roll of 1 or 2, the result is still no answer, the spell ends, and Speaker-10 must attempt an Intelligence check to avoid losing Intelligence and Charisma. The DC of this Intelligence check is increased by the same amount added to the d20 check to contact a Planar Creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNMuVct4XhxuFyhzY_description
attribs.current: Speaker-10 fires a scintillating ray at their Target, making a Ranged Attack against their target’s EAC, but they can add their Key Ability Score bonus to this Attack instead of their Dexterity Modifier if it is higher. If Speaker-10 hits and their Target fails its Will saving throw, the Target creature’s Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1 (a Modifier of –5). The affected Creature is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based Skills, cast Spells, understand language, or communicate coherently. It still knows who its friends are and can follow them and even protect them. The Target remains in this state until a Miracle, Psychic Surgery, wish, or similar spell is used to cancel the Effect. It can’t be removed by effects like break Enchantment.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNUAVH-3YHf-mtnlP_description
attribs.current:
This spell summons an Extraplanar Creature (typically an Elemental, Magical Beast Native to another plane, or Outsider, but also occasionally even Extraplanar constructs). The summoned Creature appears where Speaker-10 designates and acts immediately on their turn. It Attacks Speaker-10's opponents to the best of its ability. If Speaker-10 can communicate with the Creature, they can direct it to not Attack, to Attack particular enemies, or to perform Other Actions.

When Speaker-10 gains this spell as a spell known, select four Creatures from the appropriate list in Table 8: Summon Creature for each level at which Speaker-10 can cast this spell. For Example, for the 1st-level summon Creature spell, Speaker-10 could choose Tiny air, earth, fire, and water elementals. Note that a particular Alignment or class is sometimes required to choose certain Creatures, as listed in Table 8. In place of a single selection, Speaker-10 can choose a Creature from a lower-level Summoning list; doing so allows them the option of Summoning multiple such Creatures at a time.

Speaker-10 chooses which of the selected Creatures they summon each time they cast the spell.

5th: When Speaker-10 casts summon Creature as a 5th-level spell, they summon one Creature from their selection of Creatures from the 5th-level Summoning list. If the chosen Creature is from a lower-level Summoning list, Speaker-10 summons three such Creatures instead.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNYKdDORxRaDsi6Y0_target
attribs.current: Up to Fourteen Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More Than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNYKdDORxRaDsi6Y0_description
attribs.current: Each round, Speaker-10 concentrates on one Target within range. Speaker-10 knows if the Target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesn’t necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, Speaker-10 can concentrate on a different Target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNZk9XQ1J3xu-3kiJ_description
attribs.current:
Similar to Augury but more powerful, a divination spell can provide Speaker-10 with a useful piece of advice in reply to a question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity that is to occur within 1 week. Casting this spell requires Speaker-10 to expend 1 Resolve Point. The advice granted by the spell can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If Speaker-10 doesn’t act on the information, the Conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The chance for a correct divination is 75% ([[100]]%). If the die roll fails, Speaker-10 knows the spell failed, unless specific magic yielding false information is at work.

As with Augury, multiple castings of divination about the same topic by the same caster use the same die result as the first divination spell and yield the same answer each time.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNasYZfnT8oLhiNiF_description
attribs.current: Speaker-10 shoots a black ray at a Target, making a Ranged Attack against the target’s EAC. If Speaker-10 hits, the Target gains 2 temporary Negative Levels. Negative Levels stack. If the Target survives, it recovers from Negative Levels after a number of hours equal to 14 (maximum 15 hours). An Undead Creature struck by the ray gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNdishPqng85zsM6p_description
attribs.current: Resistant armour grants the Target (and its gear) protection from Speaker-10's choice of either Kinetic Damage or Energy Damage. If Speaker-10 chooses Kinetic Damage, the Target and her gear gain DR 10/— that protects against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If Speaker-10 chooses Energy Damage, pick any three of acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic damage. The Target and her gear gain Energy Resistance 10 that protects against the chosen types of energy. This damage reduction or Energy Resistance doesn’t stack with any damage reduction or Energy Resistance the Target already has, and multiple castings of this spell don’t stack.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNfVxr-GMxNh1Kfl8_description
attribs.current:
This spell summons an Extraplanar Creature (typically an Elemental, Magical Beast Native to another plane, or Outsider, but also occasionally even Extraplanar constructs). The summoned Creature appears where Speaker-10 designates and acts immediately on their turn. It Attacks Speaker-10's opponents to the best of its ability. If Speaker-10 can communicate with the Creature, they can direct it to not Attack, to Attack particular enemies, or to perform Other Actions.

When Speaker-10 gains this spell as a spell known, select four Creatures from the appropriate list in Table 8: Summon Creature for each level at which Speaker-10 can cast this spell. For Example, for the 1st-level summon Creature spell, Speaker-10 could choose Tiny air, earth, fire, and water elementals. Note that a particular Alignment or class is sometimes required to choose certain Creatures, as listed in Table 8. In place of a single selection, Speaker-10 can choose a Creature from a lower-level Summoning list; doing so allows them the option of Summoning multiple such Creatures at a time.

Speaker-10 chooses which of the selected Creatures they summon each time they cast the spell.

4th: When Speaker-10 casts summon Creature as a 4th-level spell, they summon one Creature from their selection of Creatures from the 4th-level Summoning list. If the chosen Creature is from a lower-level Summoning list, Speaker-10 summons three such Creatures instead.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNk-v-XsXq64XPM9b_target
attribs.current: One Creature, Object, Spell, or Spellcaster

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNk-v-XsXq64XPM9b_description
attribs.current:
Speaker-10 can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a Creature or Object, to temporarily suppress the magical Abilities of a magic item, or to counter another spellcaster’s spell. A dispelled spell ends as if its duration had expired. Some Spells, as detailed in their descriptions, can’t be defeated by dispel magic. Dispel magic can dispel (but not counter) spell-like Abilities just as it does Spells. The Effect of a spell with an Instantaneous duration can’t be dispelled.

Speaker-10 chooses to use dispel magic in one of two ways: as a targeted dispel or as a counter.

Targeted Dispel: One Creature, Object, or spell is the Target of the dispel magic spell. Speaker-10 can also use a targeted dispel to specifically end one spell affecting the Target or one spell affecting an area (such as Zone of Truth). Speaker-10 must name the specific spell Effect to be targeted in this way or otherwise uniquely Identify it (such as “that Burning wall” or “the spell that’s giving him those duplicates”). Attempt a dispel check (1d20 + 14) with a DC equal to 11 + the spell’s caster level. If Speaker-10 succeeds, the spell ends. If Speaker-10 doesn’t specify a spell and there is more than one possible spell on the Target, their targeted dispel attempts to dispel a spell at random.

If Speaker-10 Target a force, an Object, or a Creature that is the Effect of an ongoing spell (such as Unseen Servant), they attempt a dispel check to end the spell that conjured the Object or Creature.

If the Object that Speaker-10 Target is a magic item, they attempt a dispel check against the item level (DC = 11 + the item level). If Speaker-10 succeeds, all the item’s magical properties are suppressed for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds, after which the item recovers its magical properties. A suppressed item becomes nonmagical for the duration of the Effect. A magic item’s nonmagical physical properties are unchanged: a suppressed holy laser pistol is still a laser pistol. Artefacts and deities are unaffected by mortal magic such as this.
Speaker-10 can choose to automatically succeed at their dispel check against any spell they have cast.

Counter: Speaker-10 can use the energy of dispel magic to disrupt the casting of other Spells. First, select an Opponent and take the ready action to cast dispel magic when that Target casts a spell. This is considered a purely defensive action. When that readied action is triggered, you cast dispel magic and must attempt a dispel check (1d20 + 14) to counter the other spellcaster’s spell. The DC is equal to 11 + the other spellcaster’s caster level. If the check is successful and the Target is in range, the spell fails and has no result.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNlQ0jigvLX2DJWkO_description
attribs.current:
Speaker-10 divines the most vulnerable portion of their opponent’s mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The Target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no Effect on Creatures without an Intelligence score.

3rd: When Speaker-10 casts mind thrust as a 3rd-level spell, it deals 7d10 damage to the Target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsNnn87OAI7CCfMLWS_description
attribs.current: This spell grants the Creature touched the ability to speak and understand the spoken or signed language of any intelligent Creature, whether it is a racial tongue or a regional dialect. The Target can speak only one language at a time, although it may be able to understand several languages. Tongues does not enable the Target to speak with Creatures who don’t speak. The Target can make itself understood as far as its voice carries.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsODu0MFXaPWMNNnka_description
attribs.current: The following represent the most common mystic connections. See page 83 for more information on the connection class feature.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsOFhqqO6Wg3qLNKZg_description
attribs.current: Speaker-10's linked to the collective knowledge of every sentient species that ever lived that’s held in the Akashic Record, an Astral library of perfect psychic records of every moment in history. Speaker-10 might be an ancient lorekeeper, an inquisitive student of the occult, an intuitive consulting detective, or a secret-hoarding spy.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Speaker-10 casts a 5th-level and a 4th-level summon creature spell to summon air elementals in the shape of dragons, and they’ve cast resistant armour on themself.

During Combat Speaker-10 keeps their elementals as a buffer between them and the player characters, staying at range and using their spells and pistol.

Morale Speaker-10 is devoted to Ayleth and fights until slain.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Darkvision 60 ft., Low-Light Vision, Sensor Suite

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Hellhound-Class Flamethrower with 2 High-Capacity Petrol Tanks, Medium Machine Gun with 420 Heavy Rounds

attribs.name: organization
attribs.current: Solitary or Unit (1 AHAV plus 10–12 Soldiers)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-gjralSjHosVtdL7U_description
attribs.current:
An AHAV is created with one of the Mission Dependent Loadouts
Advanced Manoeuvrability: The AHAV has an extraordinary fly speed of 60 feet (perfect manoeuvrability) and the Spring Attack feat.
Autoloader: When the AHAV makes a full attack with its medium machine gun, it can make up to three attacks instead of two attacks. It takes a –5 penalty to these attacks instead of a –4 penalty.
Camouflage Plating: The AHAV gains a +20 enhancement bonus to Stealth checks.
Harrying Arms: The AHAV has numerous pistols or other small arms mounted to its chassis. As a full action, the AHAV automatically succeeds at the harrying fire action against every enemy within 60 feet.
Ram: The AHAV gains a slam attack with a +23 attack bonus that deals 6d4+17 bludgeoning damage. If the AHAV hits with this attack after a charge, the target is also knocked back 30 feet. If the target is blocked from moving the full distance, it takes an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet it can’t move.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-gjralSjHosVtdL7V_description
attribs.current: As a full action, an AHAV can gain one of the following benefits for 1 minute: blindsight (life), blindsight (vibration), sense through (vision), or a +10 enhancement bonus to Perception checks. It can change which benefit it receives as a full action. At the GM’s discretion, an AHAV might have access to more options, such as blindsight (emotion) or blindsight (thought).

attribs.current: breath weapon (30-ft. cone, 6d10 F plus radiation exposure, Reflex DC 16 half, usable every 1d6 rounds)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-hB7hosbKIGTtgmCo_description
attribs.current: A radiation drake’s atomic bolt has a range increment of 60 feet and targets EAC.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-hB7hosbKIGTtgmCp_description
attribs.current: A creature that takes Hit Point damage from the radiation drake’s attacks is exposed to low radiation. This radiation bypasses environmental protections in armour.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-hXTV5msIKnrJo8IN_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a dragonkin troop can coordinate all its members to use their breath weapons at once, creating a radius of fire extending from the troop.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-hXTV5msIKnrJo8IO_description
attribs.current: The dragonkin technomancers have trained extensively in using a few of their spells as a troop, including casting a spell in concert. Once per day, a dragonkin technomancer troop can cast a spell as a swift action.

attribs.current: @{Dragonkin Technomancer Troop|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Dragonkin Technomancer Troop|engines_status}@{Dragonkin Technomancer Troop|power_core_status}@{Dragonkin Technomancer Troop|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLOI6sUjui67SYJ1G_description
attribs.current:
A dragonkin technomancer troop fires two Missiles of magical energy that strike Targets unerringly (the Creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 force damage each. The dragonkin technomancer troop can’t Target specific parts of a Creature, and objects are not damaged by the spell.

The dragonkin technomancer troop can Target a single Creature or several Creatures, but each missile can strike only one Creature. The dragonkin technomancer troop must designate Targets before they attempt to overcome Spell Resistance or roll damage.

The dragonkin technomancer troop can cast this spell as a Full Action. If the dragonkin technomancer troop do, they fire three Missiles instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLDlfAu65ztrxUGkH_description
attribs.current: A dragonkin technomancer troop causes an electrical device in their possession to surge in power and unleash a line of electricity from the massive oversurge. This deals 10d6 electricity damage to all Creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLFI4J4X-6H7jLrW8_target
attribs.current: One Creature, Object, Spell, or Spellcaster

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLFI4J4X-6H7jLrW8_description
attribs.current:
A dragonkin technomancer troop can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a Creature or Object, to temporarily suppress the magical Abilities of a magic item, or to counter another spellcaster’s spell. A dispelled spell ends as if its duration had expired. Some Spells, as detailed in their descriptions, can’t be defeated by dispel magic. Dispel magic can dispel (but not counter) spell-like Abilities just as it does Spells. The Effect of a spell with an Instantaneous duration can’t be dispelled.

The dragonkin technomancer troop chooses to use dispel magic in one of two ways: as a targeted dispel or as a counter.

Targeted Dispel: One Creature, Object, or spell is the Target of the dispel magic spell. The dragonkin technomancer troop can also use a targeted dispel to specifically end one spell affecting the Target or one spell affecting an area (such as Zone of Truth). The dragonkin technomancer troop must name the specific spell Effect to be targeted in this way or otherwise uniquely Identify it (such as “that Burning wall” or “the spell that’s giving him those duplicates”). Attempt a dispel check (1d20 + 9) with a DC equal to 11 + the spell’s caster level. If the dragonkin technomancer troop succeeds, the spell ends. If the dragonkin technomancer troop doesn’t specify a spell and there is more than one possible spell on the Target, theirtargeted dispel attempts to dispel a spell at random.

If the dragonkin technomancer troop Target a force, an Object, or a Creature that is the Effect of an ongoing spell (such as Unseen Servant), they attempt a dispel check to end the spell that conjured the Object or Creature.

If the Object that the dragonkin technomancer troop Target is a magic item, they attempt a dispel check against the item level (DC = 11 + the item level). If the dragonkin technomancer troop succeeds, all the item’s magical properties are suppressed for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds, after which the item recovers its magical properties. A suppressed item becomes nonmagical for the duration of the Effect. A magic item’s nonmagical physical properties are unchanged: a suppressed holy laser pistol is still a laser pistol. Artefacts and deities are unaffected by mortal magic such as this.
The dragonkin technomancer troop can choose to automatically succeed at their dispel check against any spell they have cast.

Counter: The dragonkin technomancer troop can use the energy of dispel magic to disrupt the casting of other Spells. First, select an Opponent and take the ready action to cast dispel magic when that Target casts a spell. This is considered a purely defensive action. When that readied action is triggered, the dragonkin technomancer troop casts dispel magic and must attempt a dispel check (1d20 + 9) to counter the other spellcaster’s spell. The DC is equal to 11 + the other spellcaster’s caster level. If the check is successful and the Target is in range, the spell fails and has no result.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLIlzsssPSd5udHki_description
attribs.current: A dragonkin technomancer troop flings magical nanites that convert water vapour around their Target into deadly acid. Make a Ranged Attack roll against the dragonkin technomancer troop's target’s EAC. If the dragonkin technomancer troop hits, the Target takes 4d4 acid damage and it takes 5 additional acid damage at the end of its turn each round for the spell’s duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLKEzFm63Kidz1kPG_description
attribs.current:
A dragonkin technomancer troop can see any Invisible or ethereal objects or beings within your range of Vision, as if they were normally visible. Such Creatures are visible to the dragonkin technomancer troop as translucent shapes, allowing you easily to discern the difference between visible and Invisible or ethereal Creatures.

The spell doesn’t reveal the method used to obtain Invisibility, doesn’t reveal illusions or enable the dragonkin technomancer troop to see through opaque objects, and doesn’t reveal Creatures that are simply concealed, hiding, or otherwise hard to see.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsLOI6sUjui67SYJ1G_target
attribs.current: Up to Three Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 15 ft. Apart; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsMOQmcCOHeSutawJt_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a foot soldier troop can move up to its speed and through the space of any creatures or mechs that are at least one size smaller than the overall troop (Gargantuan), functioning as trample.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsMU0ZFv7rPXqU1tm3_description
attribs.current: Ayleth’s soldiers train to imitate the ferocity of dragons. Every creature who takes damage from the troop, or who is piloting a vehicle or mech that takes damage from the troop, must succeed at a DC 16 Will save or be shaken for 1d4 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-igSr9RxLFKSwLJZH_description
attribs.current: Airborne creatures take a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls against an air elemental

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-igSr9RxLFKSwLJZI_description
attribs.current: The creature can transform into a whirlwind. Unless otherwise specified, the creature can remain in whirlwind form for a number of rounds equal to half its CR. If the creature has a fly speed, it retains that in its whirlwind form. If it does not have a fly speed, it gains an extraordinary fly speed (with average maneuverability) equal to its base speed. A creature in whirlwind form can move freely into and through other creatures' spaces, and it does not provoke attacks of opportunity as a result of its movement.                                                                                                                              The base of a creature in whirlwind form occupies a 5-foot square, and the whirlwind is twice as wide at its top as its base; this doesn't change the size category of the creature. If a creature is Large or larger, it can vary the size of its whirlwind form up to a maximum of a base equal to its normal space as a swift or move action. A creature in whirlwind form does not threaten any spaces around it, and it cannot make its normal attacks.                                                                                                   If a creature in whirlwind form enters the space of another creature, that creature must succeed at a Fortitude save with the listed DC or take the whirlwind's listed damage. If the whirlwind covers all of the creature's space, the creature must also succeed at a Reflex save or be picked up by the whirlwind and carried along with it. A carried creature is flat-footed, grappled, and off-target, and it automatically takes the whirlwind's damage at the beginning of its turn. If the carried creature can fly, it can attempt a Reflex save as a move action, escaping on a successful save. If a carried creature does not escape, it can attempt a Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it can take any remaining actions it has on its turn (other than movement). On a failed save, the carried creature is unable to act until its next turn or until the whirlwind releases it.                                                                                     A creature in whirlwind form can carry up to two creatures of its size, with the total number it can carry doubling for every size category the affected creatures are smaller than the whirlwind. The creature in whirlwind form can eject a carried creature at any time during its turn, dropping the carried creature in a space of its choice adjacent to its position at the time of ejection. At the GM's discretion, if the whirlwind is in contact with dirt, gases, water, or other material that can be easily drawn into it, the whirlwind blocks all vision within it (including darkvision) and blocks line of sight through it.                                                                                                                         Format: Offensive Abilities whirlwind (4d6+8 B, DC 15, 1/day).                                       Guidelines: This ability is generally usable once per day, plus one additional time per day for every 5 CR the creature has. The amount of damage the whirlwind deals should be the same as the creature's standard melee damage. Whirlwinds normally deal bludgeoning damage.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsense (Scent) 60 ft., Darkvision 90 ft., Low-Light Vision, Weathersight

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPJKB1ixb4K0SCZ_description
attribs.current: A barrage of fist-sized hailstones pelts the area. Creatures that enter or start their turn in the area during the first round of the spell take 6d8 cold damage and 7d8 bludgeoning damage. For the remaining duration of the spell, Heavy Snow and sleet rain down in the area. Until the spell is dismissed or until the end of the duration, this area provides Concealment, Creatures inside it take a –4 penalty to Perception checks, and the entire area is considered difficult Terrain.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPLHhiCrWp9uexR_description
attribs.current: The Creature or Object touched becomes Invisible. If the Target is a Creature, any gear it is carrying vanishes as well. If a stormghost casts the spell on someone else, neither the it nor its allies can see the Target unless it can normally see Invisible things or it employs magic to do so.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPMjTSZzBz1jIDC_description
attribs.current:
A stormghost can alter the atmosphere within the spell’s area to cause it to become more like the atmosphere of another planet. The stormghost can alter one aspect of the atmosphere—its corrosiveness, density, or toxicity. The possible effects of each of these changes are detailed below.

Corrosiveness: The stormghost can make the atmosphere corrosive. Each creature and object in the area when you cast the spell must succeed at a Fortitude save or take 5d6 acid damage. Creatures and objects that remain in the area take 3d6 additional acid damage every 10 minutes (Fortitude half).

Alternatively, the stormghost can make a normally corrosive atmosphere noncorrosive. In this case, the atmosphere within the spell’s area deals no acid damage for the duration of the spell.

Density: The stormghost can make the atmosphere in the area one step thinner (going from severely thick to thick, thick to normal, normal to thin, or thin to severely thin) or thicker (going from severely thin to thin, thin to normal, normal to thick, or thick to severely thick). The spell cannot make an atmosphere thicker than severely thick or thinner than severely thin.

In addition to the normal long-term effects of being in an atmosphere thinner or thicker than a creature is acclimated to, each creature in the area of the spell when it is cast must succeed at a Fortitude save or suffer the immediate effects described below. This is true even for creatures with environmental protection from equipment (such as armour), as the air within the armour is affected on a failed saving throw. Creatures that do not need to breathe are not affected by changes in atmospheric density.

If the air is thicker than a creature is acclimated to, on a failed saving throw, that creature becomes sickened. For every step beyond the first that the air is thicker than the target’s acclimation, it takes a –1 penalty to its save against this effect. If the air is thinner than a creature is acclimated to, on a failed saving throw, it is fatigued. For every step beyond the first that the air is thinner than the target’s acclimation, it takes a –1 penalty to its saving throw against this effect. The effect ends if the creature moves out of the area, and it is not required to attempt a new saving throw upon reentering the area (instead it is subject only to the normal dangers of thicker or thinner air).

Toxicity: The stormghost can make the atmosphere toxic. Each creature in the area of the spell when it is cast must succeed at a Fortitude save or suffer the immediate effects described below. Creatures with environmental protection from equipment already active (such as armour) are not exposed to the toxic atmosphere. A creature that fails its save contracts bubonic plague (no save) and immediately moves to the weakened state. Creatures that enter the area of toxic atmosphere later are exposed to inhaled bubonic plague and follow the normal disease rules for contracting the disease and progressing on the physical disease track. The disease is nonmagical, and those infected are still infected when the spell’s duration ends.

Alternatively, the stormghost can make a normally toxic atmosphere nontoxic. In this case, the atmosphere within the spell’s area does not expose those who breathe it to any toxic disease for the duration of the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPMjTSZzBz1jIDD_description
attribs.current:
A stormghost creates an enervating ray of magic. The stormghost must make a Ranged Attack against its opponent’s EAC. On a hit, the Target is immediately Exhausted for the spell’s duration. A Creature that succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw is only Fatigued, unless it is already Fatigued, in which case it instead becomes Exhausted despite the saving throw.
This spell has no Effect on a Creature that is already Exhausted. Unlike Normal exhaustion or Fatigue, the Effect ends as soon as the spell’s duration expires.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPN8LmZBhQ3BwZO_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a stormghost can leap up to 30 feet and land adjacent to a target that is at least one size smaller than themself and impale the victim with their spiky legs. The target must succeed at a DC 21 Reflex save or take 4d8+24 points of piercing damage and gain the pinned condition until the beginning of the stormghost’s next turn, at which point the stormghost can attempt to renew the pinned condition with a grapple combat manoeuvre as normal.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPN8LmZBhQ3BwZP_description
attribs.current: Crackling electricity surrounds a stormghost. As a standard action once every 1d4 rounds, a stormghost can focus this static charge into a bolt, releasing it in a 40-foot line that deals 8d6 electricity damage. A successful DC 20 Reflex save halves this damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jBPN8LmZBhQ3BwZQ_description
attribs.current: A stormghost can see perfectly through dust, fog, mist, rain, heavy snow, and smoke. They ignore concealment and penalties to Perception checks from such effects.

attribs.current: Advanced Iridishell (Infrared Sensors, Mk 1 Thermal Capacitor), Aurora Stun Staff, Drake Dragon Rifle with 2 Tanks (20 Petrol each)

attribs.current: As a full action, a skyborne spire guard can move up to twice their speed and make one attack, but their target must be a creature threatening an ally. Once the skyborne spire guard has used this ability, they cannot do so again until they have taken a 10-minute rest to regain Stamina Points.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: All-Around Vision, Darkvision 60 ft., Low‑Light Vision

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAR_description
attribs.current: Nanites swarm within 5 feet of the nanotech golem, and the golem can enter an opponent’s space, provoking an attack of opportunity from that foe. At the end of each of the golem’s turns, each creature within 5 feet of the golem or sharing its space takes 8d6 piercing damage and is nauseated for 1 round. A successful DC 20 Fortitude saving throw halves the damage and negates the condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAS_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a nanotech golem can unleash a stream of nanite particles at a single target as a kinetic attack with a range increment of 90 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAT_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem is immune to critical hits, as well as entangled, flat-footed, off-kilter, off-target, pinned, prone, and staggered effects. It takes only half damage from any attack or effect that targets only one creature. Automatic fire must hit the golem as if it were three targets to deal full damage to it. In addition, the golem can move through openings 1 inch wide without squeezing, and it can squeeze to move through microscopic openings.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAU_description
attribs.current: A cybernetic or nanotech golem is immune to any spell or spell-like ability that allows spell resistance, unless the spell specifically lists constructs in its Targets entry. In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against the golem as follows. The golem can be affected by discharge or greater discharge but has a unique reaction to the spells. If the golem fails a saving throw against either spell, it becomes confused for 1d4 rounds instead of suffering the spell’s normal effect. The golem can attempt a Fortitude save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success. Magical effects that deal cold damage slow (as the slow spell) the golem for 3 rounds (no save). If the golem has a haste circuit and it is active, this effect counters the haste circuit but has no other effect. The golem automatically fails saving throws against weapons and magical effects that deal electricity damage. However, such an effect merely breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals it for 1 Hit Point per 3 damage the effect would have dealt. Any damage that exceeds the golem’s maximum Hit Points is stored as charges for its weapons, at a rate of 1 charge per Hit Point the golem would have gained. Any additional damage is ignored.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAV_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem sees in all directions at once.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-jphXP-zWk4jFRtAW_description
attribs.current: A golem can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: weaknesses
attribs.current: Vulnerable to Critical Hits, Vulnerable to Electricity

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Holographic Camouflage, Nanite Repair, Target Tracking, Unliving

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Microserrated Longsword, Advanced Semi-Auto Pistol with 48 Small Arm Rounds, Advanced Shirren-Eye Rifle with 16 Sniper Rounds

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-k0nwueoqUVGAF4tX_description
attribs.current: An assassin robot uses advanced sensors in conjunction with a holographic projector to blend in with its surroundings. If the assassin robot remains still for 1 round, it gains a +10 bonus to Stealth checks and is treated as having concealment until it moves out of its square; this doesn’t stack with invisibility or similar effects. As a move action, the robot can amplify this camouflage for up to 10 rounds per day, using the duration in 1-round increments. While the camouflage is amplified, the robot is affected as if by the invisibility spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-k0nwueoqUVGAF4tY_description
attribs.current: As a full action, an assassin robot can move up to its speed, blurred by holographic camouflage, and then make an attack with a one-handed melee weapon or small arm. After its movement, the robot can attempt a Stealth check; this check is opposed by a Perception check attempted by its target, and if the robot is successful, its target is flat-footed against the attack and takes 5d8 additional damage on a hit.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-k0nwueoqUVGAF4tZ_description
attribs.current: When not in use, each of an assassin robot’s weapons is folded inside the robot’s body and hidden from sight. A creature unaware of the robot’s hidden weapons must succeed at a DC 35 Perception check to notice one. An assassin robot can deploy any or all of its weapons as a swift action or as part of making an attack or full attack. Its weapons are mounted, leaving the robot’s hands free, and the robot can’t be disarmed of them. As a swift action, the robot can retract any or all of its weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-k0nwueoqUVGAF4ta_description
attribs.current: As a move action, an assassin robot can lock on to one target it can see. The tracked target doesn’t benefit from concealment against the robot and can’t succeed at Bluff checks against the robot to create a diversion. This tracking ends if the tracked target dies or is destroyed, the robot ceases being able to see the target, or the robot ends it as a move action.

offensive_abilities
attribs.current: deconstruction cage (3d6+13 A, EAC 27, KAC 27, 56 HP), trample (3d12+21 B, DC 19)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Decimator Disintegrator Cannon, Platoon Minelayer with 4 Decoupler Grenades IV

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-NK-kEZu87Jt6i-mT7xQ_name
attribs.current: integrated platoon minelayer with decoupler grenades IV

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-NK-kEZu87Jt6i-mT7xQ_special
attribs.current: explode (15 ft., nanite cloud 1 minute, corrode 4d4, DC 17)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-kEZyiWFrMxyftlWw_description
attribs.current: Collective-9’s deconstruction cage works as the swallow whole ability, except the target is placed in a cage on the construct’s body rather than completely swallowed. All attacks that hit the cage deal only half damage to it, and attacks that hit it from the outside deal its occupant half the damage the cage takes. If the cage is damaged enough to allow a creature to escape, Collective-9 can’t use the cage again for 24 hours, at which point it is repaired. A creature can escape the cage by succeeding at a DC 29 Engineering check to disable the door or a DC 29 Athletics check to break it open. Each time a creature takes damage from the deconstruction cage, Collective-9 regains 1 Hit Point for every 4 the victim loses as the construct’s nanite constituents use the harvested material for repairs. This deconstruction targets gear inside the cage after a creature in the cage dies, dealing the gear 4 damage each minute, ignoring hardness, and restoring 1 Hit Point to Collective-9 each time this damage occurs.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-kEZyiWFrMxyftlWx_description
attribs.current: Collective-9 doesn’t need batteries for its disintegrator cannon or similar powered weapons. It can produce 1 decoupler grenade for its minelayer every 2 hours. Tripods that use other weapons can produce those weapons’ ammunition at similar rates. If these weapons are removed from Collective-9, they can be fitted with conventional ammunition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-kEZyiWFrMxyftlWy_description
attribs.current: Collective-9 can communicate wirelessly. This acts as telepathy, but only with other creatures with this ability or constructs with the technological subtype.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsTfjAZ9PHZRwMImMT_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a fulmivar moves from its current location into a randomly chosen technological item. The item’s electronics are temporarily overloaded, imparting the broken condition to the item for 1d4+1 rounds. If a creature is carrying or wielding the item, they take 1d10+11 electricity damage. An affected creature can attempt a DC 20 Reflex saving throw to halve the damage and reduce the amount of time the item is broken to 1 round; an unattended item receives no save. The fulmivar can arc between multiple technological items in this way, as long as its total movement doesn’t exceed 60 feet, but the fulmivar can’t affect more than one item in the same space. This movement doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity. Once the fulmivar uses this ability, it can’t use it again until after it has used its galvanic pulse wave attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsTfjAZ9PHZRwMImMT_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Item is Broken for [[1d4+1]] Rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsTfjAZ9PHZRwMImMT_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Item is Broken for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NKsU1cHgd5x57RUWHZM_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a fulmivar can project an electrically charged wave of energy with a range increment of 80 feet. If the attack is successful, the target takes the listed damage and each creature adjacent to the target must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be staggered for 1 round. This attack has the unwieldy weapon special property.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWFYvWvJZnxWRwBF6_duration
attribs.current: 14 Rounds (D) and Concentration + 3 Rounds; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWFYvWvJZnxWRwBF6_description
attribs.current:
Miranelle becomes Invisible (as greater Invisibility), and at the same time, a figment double of her (as per a 3rd-level casting of Holographic Image) appears. The double appears within close range (60 feet) but thereafter moves as Miranelle directs it (which requires Concentration beginning on the first round after the casting). Miranelle can make the figment appear superimposed perfectly over her own body so that observers don’t Notice an image appearing and her turning Invisible. Miranelle and the figment can then move in different directions. The double moves at Miranelle's speed and can talk and gesture as if it were real, but it can’t Attack or cast Spells, though it can pretend to do so.

The illusory double lasts as long as Miranelle concentrates upon it plus 3 additional rounds. After Miranelle ceases Concentration, the illusory double continues to carry out the same activity until the duration expires. The Invisibility lasts for 14 round, regardless of Concentration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWGWZdPgcuCjyCwu5_target
attribs.current: Up to 10 Creatures Wearing Armour within Range

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWGWZdPgcuCjyCwu5_description
attribs.current: Resistant aegis grants the Targets (and their gear) protection from Miranelle's choice of either Kinetic Damage or Energy Damage. If Miranelle chooses Kinetic Damage, the Target and her gear gain DR 5/— that protects against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If Miranelle chooses Energy Damage, a Target and her gear gain Energy Resistance 5 that protects against the acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic types of energy. This damage reduction or Energy Resistance doesn’t stack with any damage reduction or Energy Resistance the Target already has, and multiple castings of this spell don’t stack.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWLOaAyU1oTSEGAvG_description
attribs.current:
Miranelle pulls dormant mystical energy from the land and objects around her and uses it to create a swirling eddy that batters her foes and can hinder their movement. The eddy deals 4d6 bludgeoning damage to each Creature in the area. Additionally, Creatures in the area are knocked prone and are reduced to half speed while the spell is in Effect. A Creature that succeeds at a Reflex save takes only half damage and is not knocked prone, but it is still reduced to half speed. Flying Creatures within the eddy’s area must attempt an Acrobatics check to fly (DC equals the spell’s save DC) each round. Failure means the Creature cannot move for that round.

The spell deals damage and knocks Creatures prone only once. However, if a Creature leaves the spell’s area and then returns, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above again (and can attempt another Reflex saving throw). Similarly, if a Creature is not in this spell’s area when it is first cast but later moves into it, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above.

Small, unattended items (no more than light bulk) are also Thrown around in the eddy’s area. At the end of the spell’s duration, such items land in a randomly determined space within the spell’s area.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWO26o3fM22WAA7RL_description
attribs.current: Miranelle alters the gravity in an area, making a central point of high gravity that pulls creatures toward it. Each creature in the area when the spell takes effect is knocked prone unless it succeeds at a Reflex saving throw. Any creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed at a Reflex saving throw or be drawn 15 feet closer to the centre of the area. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity. Creatures adjacent to the spell’s origin point take a –2 penalty to the save to avoid being pulled.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWQJOR7Kmnx7U4Wkp_description
attribs.current: Miranelle peers across the multiverse at the possible outcomes for this timeline, watching fate branch outward. When an ally within range fails an attack roll, skill check, saving throw, or ability check, Miranelle can spend 1 Resolve Point to attempt to shift their reality to one where they succeed instead. That ally can immediately reroll the failed check. A creature can’t benefit from this spell again until they take a 10-minute rest to recover Stamina Points.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWSO5vsg55Xo64Uwn_description
attribs.current:
Miranelle forms the crater of an active volcano at a target location, immediately exposing all creatures in the area to lava (Core Rulebook 403), dealing [[2d6]] (2d6) fire damage immediately, and continuing to expose creatures who begin their turn in the area, who take the appropriate fire damage at the beginning of their turn. Damage from the lava continues for [[1d3]] (1d3) rounds after a creature leaves the area, but this additional damage is only [[1d6]] (1d6) fire damage per round.
In addition, every [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds, creatures in or within 30 feet of the crater must succeed at a Reflex save or take an additional [[5d6]] (5d6) fire damage as the crater periodically erupts.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWX07BZLw38BzZMGx_description
attribs.current: Miranelle magically transforms a used Battery into a powerful explosive device, propelling it in a straight line to a grid intersection within range, at which point it detonates, dealing 9d6 fire damage to all Creatures and objects in the area. If Miranelle sends the Battery through a narrow opening, she must make a Ranged Attack (usually against an Armor Class of 10 for a narrow opening or an Armor Class of 15 for an extremely narrow opening) to avoid hitting the side and detonating it prematurely.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWZB8nGvxvexZi6DM_target
attribs.current: Up to Fourteen Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-NKsWZB8nGvxvexZi6DM_description
attribs.current: An affected Creature moves and Attacks at a drastically slowed rate. Creatures affected by this spell are staggered and can take only a single Move Action or Standard action each turn, but not both, and it can’t take full actions. A slowed Creature moves at half its Normal speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment). Multiple slow effects don’t stack. Slow counters and Negates haste.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat When Miranelle hears fighting from area H7, she casts resistant aegis on herself and Zavrix. On the first round of combat, she casts mislead and then uses her spells and infinite worlds ability to shape the battlefield to their advantage and draw enemies toward Zavrix. She uses swapping step each round if able to reposition creatures into less advantageous spots.

Morale Miranelle is fanatically loyal to Ayleth and fights to the death.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsense (Scent) 60 ft., Darkvision 60 ft., Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Zavrix moves into melee with any foe they can reach, attempting to maul creatures as often as possible. They use their void hide to redirect their attackers’ strikes if they miss.

Morale Zavrix fights to the death as long as Miranelle is alive; otherwise, they surrender if reduced below 40 HP.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-l7VVKU56eBr-4U-j_description
attribs.current: If Zavrix hits the same target with two claw attacks during the same turn, it can attempt a bite attack against that target with a –6 penalty to the attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NK-l7VVKU56eBr-4U-k_description
attribs.current: Zavrix can reflect some effects back at attackers or casters within 100 feet by spending 1 Resolve Point to do so, limited by the following parameters. If an attack misses Zavrix by 5 or fewer, as a reaction Zavrix can reflect the attack back at the attacker. The reflected attack deals the damage Zavrix would have taken, up to 30 damage (Reflex DC 20 for half). Similarly, if a spell of 4th level or lower targets Zavrix directly and fails to overcome Zavrix’s SR, as a reaction Zavrix can reflect the spell back at its caster as if the caster had been the target. This ability doesn’t work on effects that include Zavrix as one of multiple targets.

attribs.name: speed
attribs.current: 20 ft., Burrow 10 ft., Fly 200 ft. (Su, Perfect)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Me-mjQVG9udYqCMu3Q1_type
attribs.current: Slashing plus Grab and Carry Off

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Me-nNfZTHsDra0bs3AT_description
attribs.current: Veshaloru is extremely strong and can carry things much heavier than itself. If Veshaloru grapples a target of Large size or smaller, it can bring the creature with it when it flies. This ability can be combined with Spring Attack. If the target is Medium, Veshaloru’s fly speed is reduced to 100 feet (average); if the target is Large, Veshaloru’s fly speed is reduced to 50 feet (clumsy) and Veshaloru is flat footed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Me-n-I4l72cjS2x4aUa_description
attribs.current: As a full action, Veshaloru can fly up to twice its speed and slam into a hard surface, creating a 20 ft. radius explosion centred on the point of impact. Any creature in the blast must succeed at a DC 22 Reflex save or take 17d10 bludgeoning and fire damage and be knocked prone (a successful save halves the damage and negates the prone condition). Veshaloru retains some heat from this explosion, making its attacks more dangerous but softening its stony hide. For the next 1d4+1 rounds, Veshaloru’s attacks deal an extra 2d6 fire damage, it loses the benefit of its damage reduction, and it cannot use explosive impact.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Me-nSVArglAAIwftaZR_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Veshaloru can rip off and hurl a piece of its stony hide. This attack has a range increment of 30 feet and deals [[1d6]] damage to the meteorite drake.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Me-mqAg8LJ3Eq7kvk8R_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a meteorite drake can rip off and hurl a piece of its stony hide. This attack has a range increment of 30 feet and deals [[1d6]] damage to the meteorite drake.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Me-n3IjXN7dClweVaFU_description
attribs.current: When Veshaloru charges, it can attempt a trip combat manoeuvre in place of the normal melee attack. In addition, the creature can charge without taking the normal charge penalties to its attack roll or AC.

attribs.name: race
attribs.current: Meteorite drake (Starfinder Adventure Path #32: The Starstone Blockade 56)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Veshaloru opens combat by rocketing into the ground using his explosive impact ability, positioning to strike the maximum number of foes possible. He stays at range initially, hurling micrometeorites, and then uses Spring Attack to hit-and-run vulnerable targets.

Morale Unwilling to believe he can be defeated, Veshaloru fights to the death.

aura
attribs.current: Adamantine Extension, Frightful Presence (240 ft., DC 25)

attribs.current: 40 ft., Burrow 30 ft., Fly 250 ft. (Ex, Clumsy)

attribs.current: Aklo, Common, Draconic, Elven, Ignan, Kasatha
